title: Agile Software Developer
description: Learn best practices for using an Agile framework to build better products faster and more efficiently.
skills_learnt: Agile metrics , Sprint planning , Continuous improvement , Agile communication

reviews.content: Very happy with the program so far. Looking forward to new challenges.
The program is doing great. It matches my expectation very well.

So far so good. The first course was packed of new information, I found if very valuable. I personally don't like doing PowerPoint presentations ( I am SW engineer, I like code, not words :-D ) , but, eventually, I managed to make it through.

I am happy with the program and the first part of it was both interesting and informative. The project was beautiful and complex and a true challenge. I would have loved to read the 'solution' of it or, at least, have a more detailed output in my project review. I would like to know if I got the right (well, there is no right clearly) PO, the right scrum master etc.  Looking forward to the next project!
It was a very good project for me to implement the stuff that I have learned.
Nine nice
Really great!
The program is Great! I have learned so far a lot of new things and the program is very interesting and practice Oriented.

The program is nicely made and it made mostly fun. But sometimes the videos do not display the information in the tasks. Unfortunately, I forgot to write it down and can't provide feedback where this was.
The program is rich and an ideal match of my expectations
It was great learning. I had fun making the first project
Fantastic course i am really enjoying it. I would recommend that the deck that the instructor uses is made available for download to the students.
All good so far
It's going well so far!
This is a great course. I have learnt agile and have an overview idea which is quite beneficial for my work.
Enjoying it, it's informative and has definitely helped my development in Product and Agile.
Going great

Everything is going well, project was quite tricky, but was very nice to get feedback and pass it! I feel that my knowledge is growing incrementally. It was nice to get feedback and additional resources to read, would be great to have these links in learning material.
it is very informative but a bit too much information to memorize
I learned a lot, and actually, I recommended it to my colleagues who started doing it.
This program met all my expectations.
It's very simple to understand and very well explained.

This program gives me hope. On all my works as a programmer for more than 10 years I have saw weak management, bad processes and completely no agreements respect by POs. At some point I completely lost hope to Agile and opportunity to good processes. After I left my job for my own business I took this program to learn just theory and planed to use it in my own interpretation. But I got so much more. Now I know than I'm not the only one who see it this way. And it's so pleasure to listen right words from people who know what Agile really is. Thank you for that!
The program is Great . I feel that I'm learning lots of new things about agile really exited
actually, this is the best Nono Agile program in the world
Fully matched my expectation
great
So far the program is reaching my expectation. I'm able to learn and practice with a real scenarios which is very good to clear and deep understand of what I'm learning in the videos.
Awesome
I am enjoying the program so far - the layout and thought that has gone in to the lessons is vastly superior to any other online course I have taken.

Yes, it's going good.  I would love to have more course materials as a take away, maybe after completion, like blank burn up or burn down charts that I could use at work, or maybe image assets that visualize Agile principles.  WOuld be a good reward for course completion, to take with me AND promote udacity?  LIke a high res pdf or jpg of 12 agile principles and 4 core values?  just an idea.
Yes. I really love the program. I think extra resources for me to read will be better.
Excellent Intro to Agile
Thanks All It is so powerful and informative program
It's demanding but I gained a lot of practical knowledge.
The nanoprogramm really gives a good insight to the agile development subject. from fundamentals to different examples. I really enjoy learning with udacity.
yes, it's matched my expectations
it's going great
It is going very well, yes it meets my needs and expectations.
Right on track - very experienced crew behind the course. Many thanks, Philippe
I am using Udacity since 2013, I have learned Python here, and this Agile PM nanodegree has the same high quality of online education that I received here through the years.
I appreciate the responsiveness of the mentors and their support
The best things about the Udacity's nanodegree, are the projects and reviews. I recommend it 100%
Oustanding experience!
Good Teacher, Case study
Awesome!
Its going well. I would like to have seen greater emphasis on the product development lifecycle, as well as examples of each artefact.
In the upcoming projects, I need more details about the project.   Thank you.
Going great!
It has matched my expectations and I've learnt a lot from this program. However, I really think, Udacity should incorporate the use of a tool like Atlassian's Jira.
It has far exceeded my expectations. The content is engaging and the mentor ship is wonderful!
good structured, nice trainings and very quick and helpful feedback on the submissions
Going great. The projects are really hands on and aligned with what is actually needed in real Agile settings.
So far I really like the program and can recommend it.
It was informative. The content was very logical.
Wow! Intensive and content-rich! Glad I joined this nanodegree
I think the program is going great. I really have hope and deep in my knowledge and Agile practices and I can‚Äôt wait to apply this to my career.
The program is OK. Maybe I expected more when I bought it...
I am very happy. Thank my teacher. They give very good feedback. :)

The program is awesome. I really like it. It feels so good to learn everything about agile software development on this level. It's definitely it's money worth. The review on my first project was super and I learned a lot from it. Never had a comparable instructive experience in online learning.
very nice

I love to learn how to apply knowledge and what could be important working on business case and presenting finding to prospective client. It makes this program unique.  A bit weird presented methodology, but I understand is like it presented within IT industry. Anyway it's a great experience so far. Will see how it goes with the next proejct.
loooooove it
This program has given a good insight on how Agile is evaluated and implemented. All the areas related to agile are explained well.
Introduction to Agile methodologies and to its most common frameworks in a simple, easy and intuitive way
It is a comprehensive program and totally covers A-Z topics of Agile software development.
Great content. Very well structured and directly applicable to my job.
very good mixture of input and practice to integrate subject matter! Project-Reviews come quickly (in some parts they seem to be written quite hurriedly)

I think the information is great. The first project may be a bit much with 2 presentations. Also, I had a bit of trouble with the section about training/coaching. It would probably be good to have a section in the course that explains or gives some examples of this since we are students learning this and not actual coaches with experience. Overall though, happy with the course so far.
expensive but it has matched some needs and expectations. if i find a new job i will be happier with the program :)
wonderful
Going great. Love that it is self-paced.

Excellent program for an Agile beginner like me. The content is outstanding, engaging and thorough. I found everything I learned to be very applicable both inside and outside software development and data science. The only thing I did not like were the projects, I think they were mostly a chore, but I highly recommend the  Nanodegree!!
I am really happy and satisfied with first lesson and the project Thank you for the effort you done to make this program the way it is

To be honest, I was not sure at first because of the troubles I have had learning new things. Plus not having anything to reference what I'm learning to, made it hard up until the first project and working on that and finding all the information and putting it to use made things come in more clear then before. The second part after the 1st project seems to be easier to understand and see how everything that I learned before ties in with Agile. I love Udacity and the learning experience that I have had since I have started. Even been considering taking another course after this one.

title: Data Architect
description: The Data Architect Nanodegree program will be to propel learners to an advanced data professional role as a Data Architect.
skills_learnt: Data architecture fluency , Master data management , Big data fluency , Data quality assessment
prerequisites: Basic computer programming , Relational database basics , Basic SQL

reviews.content: I learned new things I didn't know and also got additional knowledge on things I already had experience with! Matched my expectations totally!
excellent content and instructor   just if we can skip the sql basics like CRUD functions as i think this nanodegree candidate is already familiar with it.
its great, more work than I anticipated so its taking longer than I thought!
Yes i am satisfied and it is interesting
I think it is not an easy program which is good for me. It seems that the content are simple, however, exercises and projects are tricky.
Quite fun and had a lot of information.
The program is excellent and provides a great way of testing proper skills needed.
Excellent program.I really enjoyed
to many steps to finish the first project
Yeah the first project was pretty good and the content so far has actually been really useful in my job.
The program is very interesting; a lot of new topics
The program is going great, the best part is the final project, because we can apply the theory into real world problems.
Program is good. It make my knowledge organized. I am thinking I made right decision to attend this course.
Realistic project and great feedback from reviewer.

The program is meeting my expectations. There is a good balance between theory and practice, and the final project was a good challenge and very useful to consolidate the learning. The feedback on the final project was very quick and the review was very detailed.
Great so far!
I really loved the atention of the reviewer and this project were so challenging.
Helped me to understand the data modeling concepts
good thanks
Excellent and challenging project. Covered all content mentioned in the lessons.
Great.
it'a amazing, course designed very well and reviewers provide professional advice
I was extremely pleased with the complexity and information presented in this course. The project was challenging and exactly what I needed to better grasp the concepts.
The first part of the program was good, based on basic concepts, wich makes me remember a few of them. Really great.
Very detailed comments! Thank you.
I'm enjoying it; good content and like that, I am getting reference links.
I like reviews because I have learned a lot!
Even if I work in IT area for many years, I have found many useful hints to improve my work! Thanks!
Great going so far

Enjoyed the first module and project, and appreciate the useful feedback

Good basic introduction, project work was challenging. But environment provided was Postgresql 9.5 and questions asked as part of project work submission required Postgresql 10.+, making it difficult to test submission.
Until now is great, but i only finished the first project so is difficult to give one exact opinion.
So far learning environment and content of the course has exceeded my expectations.
all ok

The program is great so far. Very hands on and well structured.
The projects and courses I want are the next ones. But it was important to review some concepts and learn new tools like Lucidchart.
Good experience

Excellent Content and real-world problems are available for the walkthrough, I'm always impressed by the content and approach taken in these courses to teach new skills. I would definitely recommend this course to candidates who want looking to excel in their career in Data related fields.
Its a great program
i am very happy with everything. Good Job!
First part was well balanced
It was pretty good for understanding the basics of DB modeling & implementation & then to try it out with a pseudo real-world example definitely helped in supporting that understanding.

All the information is relevant that I can apply to my work. Some speakers are not very clear but I am using text. There was quick feedback when I submitted my first project. This keeps motivation up. Also feedback was very good and there was a lot of it.

Good foundational stuff
great

it is going well and I hope to gain even more knowledge by filling in my knowledge gaps and gaining new knowledge.
it's okay )

title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer
description: The Full Stack JavaScript Developer Nanodegree program will equip learners with everything a developer needs to build rich experiences delivered with the web using modern architecture and technology.
skills_learnt: API development , AWS elastic beanstalk , Angular cli , Scripting
prerequisites: Basic typescript , HTTP , Command line interface basics

reviews.content: Until now it's going great!
l learn a lot with this course.!
The details and examples were so good. Everything was explained in an extremely professional way.

It's great! I love Udacity. It has matched my needs and expectations. I'm going through a job transition so am not able to devote as much time to it as I had wanted but I'm learning a ton of useful skills.
The availability of transcripts has been great for me and the feedback given on submissions was very great too
Its going well
Amazingly well! Chockfull of good content and very engaging.
Excellent
Hard but hopefully relevant
Overall, it's great!  I'm learning a lot!
By far you are putting all lessons in practice with final projects and it includes update topics
So far so good. The projects are really good projects.
the program is good, but could use more detailed info related to completing the projects. for example, for project 1, more background in TS would be helpful.
I've been learning a lot and explained a lot of topics with details

I really loved this course. Sadly, I underestimated how much time I needed in order to finish all 4 courses so that's why i'm far behind. Overall experience tho, it was really fun, helpful and I learned a lot. Thank u
Very good!

I like it, however I find areas where it lacks. There are things that need to be updated or there are things that should be taught but aren't, for example ending a response object or how to handle errors with middleware. Also, there are instructions that provide information that is wrong in the project e.g. with dependency installation
it is very awesome program, Learned a lot of things related to NodeJS and Backend Development
I really like it. But things that would make it awesome for me is more video content, I just learn much better with video content :)
Thank you so much!, I had a good experience
I love that for each course we have a project, where we can take what we learned into action
It is a strongly challenging program so far.
So far it meets my expectations for BE development I love it

I've learned a great deal about the development process using Node/Express as well as other tools such as Jasmine and etc... I would say the program matched my needs and expectations because I get to work on a relevant and challenging project. Lastly feedback that I received from the reviewer are informative and professional.
I enjoyed it
Great
So far it is going perfectly fine
Awesome topics and the instructors do a fabulous job teaching the topics, and the reviewers give some great feedback

This program's technical expectations are way higher than advertised but that is a good thing for me personally because I was actually looking for a fast paced learning program that allowed me to quickly grow as a full stack engineer. I get that full stack engineering is a vast topic and not everything can be covered in a small 4 month program but the teachers and reviewers provide really cutting edge articles and blogs that help you to grow even further. Only thing i would have preferred was that the in classroom exercises provided packages that could be downloaded easily and could be done on our own computers rather than going in to the built in jupyter notebook environments.

So far the material has been presented in a way that builds on previous lessons. Even though this is the first time I've used node.js and typescript, I feel that I can keep up. I'm glad I can go back to previous lessons since it's difficult to absorb everything (or know exactly what needs to be absorbed) the first time.
Going well.

The project is very helpful. I can use what I learnt from the course and combine them together. Also during the process, I met lots of detail problem, by resolving them I can understand typescript deeper.
It's everything I currently need in my professional life üòä
I am very happy on how is going until the moment, it matches my expectations!

After the first project the program is meeting the expectations and teaches you a good amount of material. Besides that there are plenty of extra resources offered for better understanding. The project is demanding, requires research but equipped with the knowledge acquired with the lessons one should be able to find the resources necessary and understand them. Overall totally recommended
This program is exactly what i expected.
This course fills helps me fill the gaps to work with JS.
It is going well, I just wish there were office hours or somehow a chance to ask questions in real time
with all the information I read, I improved my APIs programming skills
The program is not bad so far, but I think it should be a little bit more complex. Maybe including additional projects (two/three projects per block for example).

I loved the course and the project, everything was awesome! I was expecting to know more about web different protocols like WebSocket, SMTP, and HTTP 'in-depth' (for example what's the best practice to POST an image to a server, or send a scheduled email) Thank you all! <3

Finishing the first project feels like a nice achievement to me.  It really tied everything together and have me going back to the lessons and exercises.  All the code reviewers are very professional and nice, all of them went through the project very thoroughly and provided detailed findings and suggestions.
The content and guidance helped me to be able to complete the project.
great stuff
I have only finished the 1st project and I am really happy with how things are going. I hope it remains like this till the end of this course.

The nanodegree program seems to be first non rushed attempt to explain all the core concepts of full stack software development I have seen so far. Despite having some experience on the subject I have tried new things, worked on new libraries and learned some cool tricks on the way so far.
So far so good. The combination of the videos, text and practice projects are great.

The learning experience is excellent and challenging. Other courses (i.e. Treehouse, Udemy) hand hold you through the projects. This way, being taught the basics, then given the 'job' to do forces you to learn the topics on your own.  Much like in the real world.
Very good!  I am learning a lot.
Learning a lot :)
It's going great. As expected! üòÉ
It is fine so far.
I am really enjoying it! First project was very challenging i loved it
Great

This Nanodegree is really solidifying my server side coding with JavaScript skills. Having graduated from Front End Web Developer Nanodegree, I know how challenging Udacity's programs are but the best part is, you almost get real work like development experience. I started my MEAN stack development three years back, but implemented projects with callback hell and wrote code that was not easily maintainable. But with my very first project itself, I implemented my Image Processing API with TypeScript, wrote unit tests with Jasmine and used best practices like writing my own utility middlewares, used Promises with Async/ Await and overall no spaghetti code. I'm confident this will turn me from an Intermediate Full Stack Developer to Advanced one by end of the course. Also highly recommended for Front End Developers who want to pick up Server Side skills with out favourite JavaScript. Thanks team Udacity for a wonderful course.
I like the program. I am learning exactly what I wanted to learn and what I was willing to pay for.
Love the program! But it was a bit hard to finish that first project.
Great!
Great as always
I have learned a ton about Node.Js and servers in general, I even learned to containerize my app and deploy it to an Azure Kubernetes cluster. I am excited to build something with persistent DB.
I am really excited to be taking this course. The feedback, the classes, and the online support are exactly what I wanted.
Yeah. This curriculum matched my expectations. The course and project are excellent.

I am learning a lot, even with topics I had studied before.  The video lessons, quizzes, challenges, and resources have definitely helped me grow my skills as a Full Stack JavaScript developer.  Project feedback was very to helpful to me to be able to successfully complete this first project.  Also, the organization of the subject matter into their own sections has been really helpful to tackle and learn different components of the stack.  Thank you Udacity!
so far pretty good.

I knew any course we take in Udacity would be excellent. The course is engaging with exercises, additional content, and projects. There are mentors who respond quickly when I get jammed with issues so that I can proceed further without wasting much time. I pretty happy with the course and definitely recommend it.
I am really appreciated for the wonderful suggestions from the reviewer. Finally, I have a rough idea about eslint, typescript and unit test.
It's going really well! So far what I've loved the most is the feedback given in the projects reviews, it's very positive and helpful to keep improving my work.
It was very interesting and I can't wait to dive deeper.
Learning a lot... thank you

It was really challenging, mostly because I was implementing most of the projects when the lessons were not yet available.   But it pushed me to be more flexible and also to search other resources in order to get it done.   The projects touch the majority of technologies and concepts that I wasn't expecting. So, I loved it.

title: Self Driving Car Engineer
description: Work on the future of autonomous vehicles and help make the self-driving car revolution a reality!
skills_learnt: Robot behavior planning , Object motion models , Robot motion planning , Eigen library

reviews.content: So mush details in this program and I have gained a lot of valuable insights.
Module 1 could have been done better.

You are supposed to use the virtual machine they give you to do this project, but it is too bad. It constantly shuts down if you don't move it and this project takes hours and hours to do. Also, there are some bugs around the object_detection project like installing torch and others.  But in general, the course covers all the main aspect of what you wanna teach. Obviously, the course is just a guide to bright our path in this world.
well done

I feel proud for finishing the project, it was very challenging because I had to search for solutions, had to get a lot of help and to persist. It was hard and I think the classes could have more examples of codes that are similar to tasks on the project, because some parts were really hard to do by myself without any reference of code. But in general, it was great.
Great!
The Program is good but it's very tough. I loved the projects, it gave me good hands-on experience. Being new to ML/Python/C++/Robotics etc is giving hard time. I am giving my best to complete it :-)
Really Good! I am really excited! To move forward!

It was difficult because I couldn't understand the lecture video alone, and I proceeded while checking related information and books by myself.However, what I learned was very meaningful and I could make use of it in the future.
It is a major jump ion toughness from the intro course. There need to be a intermediate course.
Yes, THANK YOU for ALL

Till now, after validating my first project, I think that the content is really interesting. But, regarding the first project, some details parts to be reviewed. Personally, I lost some time dealing with the workspace until I've figured out that it contains a lot of issues. Also, some links and details in the project section are not updated.
It's useful for me
Program is excellent. Some topics are very complex but material provided by instructor and help by Q/A team is enough to get over it...

Overall it was a great program. Had a lot of fun, had to break a sweat trying to code the assignments. The only con point that I would mention is the udacity platform. The quality of provided environment was really poor for some of the projects

The program is going almost smoothly, but with some difficulties. It is these difficulties that really point out my weakness of the related knowledge. This project matched my expectation and needs for CV in AD.
The program is so full of content and important lessons. I had previous experience and I have still been learning so much. Very good job.
The projects are challenging but very fun.
Amazing, so much information so much knowledge
it going on good
The first project is easier than I've expected, but I do understand because writing the pipeline.config and other given scripts from scratch would be too much for a person who has just started.

I find it great, because I was able to get a good overview over ML and how it is used to detect objects in self-driving cars. Especially helpful are the small exercises between the lessons. The only downside was that the last project was, in my opinion, not as well documented as the exercises during the lessons. But still it was good and feasible.
great
It was a really good experience to perform object detection with waymo dataset. The project allowed me to practice and remember important parts.

The contents of the course are great. It would be better to put more focus on the coding aspect of the course. The solutions of the exercises are not thorough and need more attention. The workspace provided for the project does not work well and is super slow and I had to pay for a virtual machine on Google Cloud Platform so I could run the project. The codes provided for the project had a lot of issues and I fixed most parts myself which took me quite a lot of time.

title: Discovering Ethical AI
description: Ethical AI is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we’ll introduce you to basic concepts and terms that you’ll need to step into the world of Ethical AI.

title: Intermediate JavaScript
description: The goal of this program is to prepare students for roles in web development, server-side application development, and desktop development that require advanced  JavaScript skills.
skills_learnt: JavaScript promises , Object-oriented JavaScript , Functional JavaScript , JavaScript async/await

reviews.content: Vastly matched my needs and expectations. This course is not for people with no JS experience. I highly recommend brushing up on Intro To Programming or FEND first.

The program is well structured and the projects help a lot with the practice of the concepts. If you are completely new to JavaScript I would recommend to first take the free courses on HTML and CSS, Intro to JavaScript and the DOM.

I like the program. The functional JS part I'm enjoying more because there's more videos.   The first part, object oriented javascript, felt very lengthy. I actually completed that OOJ course a few years ago and the progress didn't reset when I started the nanodegree. I think it would have been better if it had been reset. I totally forgot some of the material, yet it said I completed it.   The OOJ course had a lot of reading material. I would've liked to see more short videos like in the past.

This is the third course I take on the Udacity platform and I really like it. I feel encouraged to practice what is being taught through the exercises and especially during the final projects. The course also has great material and extra content for further development.
this program is awesome
The nanodegree is so nice. It makes my JS prorgamming better.
Im learning a lot, but i wish we were taught async operations before the first project- it held me back
yes !  it would be nicer if code review is more detailed though
Yes, I find the program to be good.
The second part of this program brings me satisfaction because I learned new things, but it is not easy, I had to work hard to achieve it and I will certainly have to rework on some concepts.

It's going really well and I like it a lot! I'm having a hard time with the jumps/levels in concepts, but I think that's a natural part of any intermediate/higher-level development course. I'm being exposed to a lot of new ideas, and really appreciate the diversity of teachers and resources.
To complete the first project I had to spend a lot of time learning outside Udacity ;-)
learning a lot on patterns
Good teaching content and the project is nice aswell!
Yes, great program, and I appreciate personal feedback on my project!
very good
Great program, great introduction to OOP in JS ;-)
The lecture videos and examples are very good. The project was challenging but forced me to do research on the different methods to complete the project.
The program is going well and I enjoy the material.
Really good program. overall I feel like I have learned a lot.

This program is a good start for intermediate skills in Javascript, but it doesn't go deep into the topics taught. I was expecting to find more design patterns, or advanced topics in functional programming like functors, monoids and nomads, or reactive programming with observables. Besides that, the program is well structured. And it helps a lot to improve skills.
Great! It's keeping me going along with new JavaScript concepts
It‚Äôs great! The methodology helped me to understand the concepts.
Meeting my expectations so far
The Program could contain some intro as a revision to intermediate JavaScript.

It was a little bit confused at the beginning. But I read README.md files you've given and rubric instructions carefully then tried to follow the guide. The commend in app.js was also really helpful..
Exceeded expectations :)

I really enjoyed developing my first project in javaScript. I am secure that the knowledge acquired here will be extremely useful in my career. The best thing was the feedback quality from the tutors.
It has been good so far
First Project was very good.
the project covered all the topics that was taught and seek proper implementation of those.

There is not a good start because this project does not fit for beginners and how to achive. Now there are no mentors for asking them directly as it was i other nano programms, you might split those project in smaller tasks.
great course. I would add move videos and examples for every topic

Overall is good and has good principles and explanations, I always learn valuable stuff from Udacity and the interactive workspace helps a lot. Projects help reinforcing and sometimes understanding more deeply  the concepts, they help you or force you sometimes to re read or review the concepts you learned in the lessons. The thing to improve I think sometimes the projects specs are not that clear and we are left wondering  for a while, however I am positive since Udacity does frequently update and review their content and also having peers and mentors should help clarify the confusion.
I enjoy the project's challenge.  It's harder than I thought but getting it together really is good hands-on experience.
going well
challenged me to use OOP approach instead of just procedural
Going great!
yes, it's been good. Some instructors could make a better effort ro help though.
excellent - thorough and challenging
I really liked the concepts I have learned here
Amazing!
it's perfect for mastering javascript
Totally! It would be could to work a bit more with the classmates.
great!going to catch up plan
Loving it
Really enjoying the program so far!
Yes I am very motivated with the course
Its going well. Work has been demanding but able to keep up and keep learning.
Yes, so far I have been able to master some concepts that were a little bit hard to grasp or even consider. Thanks guys...
It's excellent. Course content is easy to follow and at the same time covers all-important topic. It keeps the student engaged.
It is a good course , i was just expecting to go more deep inside some arrguments.

The first project was a little bit challenging. I have used JavaScript before but it was difficult to wrap the code (and my head) around classes and object. There should be more practice exercises in the course to prepare us better for the project. The course is good, I feel I am learning more about JavaScript.
It looks like we can refactor it a little more, but I was relieved to be able to clear it within the period. I'm having trouble handling the json file. I saw slack and realized that copying was fine.
The program is going great, but i would like a bit more examples.
It perfectly matched my needs and expectations. I've learned a lot throughout the course and now eager to implement them in my upcoming projects.
I am very satisfied with the content of the course.  thank you so much

It's been great.  The only thing I would say is you guys need to do a better job of specifying prerequisites.  It appears from your description like you can just take the basic javascript class and you're ready to go.  That's true from a javascript perspective, but I was not remotely prepared for all of the other front end stuff.  I literally put 20 hours into that first project, easily.  In retrospect, I needed to take the front end nano degree first, but that wasn't clear to me.
Loved it

Great. I really like the interactive learning sessions with videos and small question forms. It's much bettern than with a book. The project is really fun and it's good to have reviews. I would love to see more code reviews and hints to my own code.
Even for somebody who has been coding since childhood, this is a really good learning experience.
to be honest I expected it to be little more harder
Gain skill and some tips on javascript.
First project was ok, a bit on the easy side but not bad for getting used to javascript. I hope the next two projects are a bit more challenging.

All in all I find the course a little bit too challenging, some bits could be left out as they confuse the heck out of me without being relevant for the project, others are not even mentioned, even though the starter project code uses them (yarn / node / express), so I do feel I need to do a fair bit of additional learning outside the course to understand the code that makes up the project (it would be nice to have a reference to a good overview either inside Udacity or outside to help with that). For the first part this was not a problem and I hope the third part will be better to follow again. I am definitely making progress with what I was hoping to learn and I find the choice of projects awesome to get creative with design / UX / extra functionality and create something I can add to my portfolio and be proud of :)
very good
great!

It's good so far. I'm learning quite a bit.  I can see how learning FP will be very useful. It's moving along nicely and is paced well.  The exercises are informative and actually fun.  Overall I am very pleased with the course.
Thank you
I am truly learning important basics concepts that are very very much simplified that's why they are fairly simple to understand.

I am enjoying the program so far. The first project was a good challenge because it wasn't very complicated, but I noticed that the reviewer was a bit more strict than the reviewer from a basic JavaScript course. Going deeper into the language is what I am loving the most.

Pretty good, so far. But, for my specific taste, I understand better if I hear the information spoken, so in order to understand prototypes, for example, I had to search some tutorials on youtube in addition to the info from the course. The project was very interesting to do, found it challenging but very interesting and satisfying once I finished it.

It's going pretty good so far. The first project was a little easier than I expected, but it was great for learning how to use OOP programming w/ prototypal inheritance/class structures. The 2nd project is harder than I expected, but it's providing a good challenge. There are some errors in the lessons but nothing that interferes greatly w/ the learning process. The functional programming section was taught really well.
It's  very helpful in  providing useful info to understand complex topics.
excellent course. very useful and essencial. absolutely no any unnecessary things. Just great, thanks!
So far I have found the material very interesting.  I feel like I'm learning a lot.
Was kinda difficult at the beginning coming from languages like c++ or python, but I think the first 2 chapters are neccessary to learn the main differences regarding objects etc.

This Nanodegree program solidified my knowledge on Intermediate JavaScript. I now have a much better understanding of the differences between OOP, FP and Asynchronous Programming and how to use each one.
At the moment the program is great.  Is challenging and with good explanations.

Its really awesome, i have found trying to get all high quality content for a specific tech subject difficult. Udacity provides this content all in once place, with relevant videos and quizzes that aid learning, the end of course projects help solidify the knowledge gained.
Good and interesting. I think that should be better if there are more optional projects
It's going pretty good for me so far. Learning new things day by day.
Learning a ton!
it's been a little bit of challenge, lessons are a bit too long and the project did not challenge all aspects of the materials that were presented.
Great in meeting expectations.
great! bummed I joined before the black Friday sale

Good so far. Although I thought it would have been nice to touch on JSON and working with the DOM since it was part of the project. Also would have been nice if they would have touched on actual classes in JavaScript.
great!
It was as expected

I really enjoy the learn on your own experience.  I do think there should be a couple more videos with more examples on the first part of this course.  It seems outdated.  I was able to learn more from watching videos on YouTube (that we're easier to understand) than I was through the videos/pages on Udacity.  I'm optimistic for the rest of this course.  Thanks!
Going wonderful :)
I get help from mentors and solid my fundational skills so I am able to learn more advanced concepts
i am feeling good right now with oop  , and i can't wait to learn more about js
Very good. Finished the first project and loved the review. Thanks
I have learnt a lot of new things . Nice course
It‚Äôs going really well and it has matched all my needs and expectations so far
Going well so far, but the first section of the curriculum was almost all reading with a few intro/outro vids. Would prefer a mix of reading and explanatory vids, otherwise it can get a bit tedious.
The projects seem to be more challenging than I expected which is a very good thing. I'm looking forward to the mars dashboard project next. üòé
Super!
The first module was how I expected. Excited to continue the journey!

title: Generative AI
description: Embark on a transformative journey into Generative AI!  We'll start by diving into the essentials with an introductory course, progress to mastering text generation with Large Language Models, unravel the complexities of image creation in computer vision and cap it off by bringing AI to life in real-world applications. From foundational theories to building sophisticated chatbots and AI agents, this program will empower you with job-ready skills in the exciting field of Generative AI.
skills_learnt: Vectors , Retrieval-Augmented Generation , OpenAI API , LangChain

title: Discovering Digital Transformation
description: In this world where everything is digital, your mindset needs to be digital too. In this course, we will introduce you to the fundamental concepts that you'll need to step into the world of digital transformation.

title: Introducing Generative AI with AWS
description: "Introducing Generative AI with AWS," a beginner-level Udacity course, delves into generative AI, focusing on its fundamentals, historical context, and real-world applications. It covers AI and ML foundations, Large Language Models (LLMs) with transformer-based architectures, and the societal impacts of generative AI. The course aims to impart a deep understanding of AI's evolution, distinguish AI from ML, explore LLMs, and emphasize ethical AI deployment. It includes exercises on AI history, ML approaches, prompt engineering, and responsible AI use. Prerequisites are basic Python.
skills_learnt: Convolutional neural networks , Amazon sagemaker , Generative AI Fluency , Prompt Engineering

title: Machine Learning Engineer with Microsoft Azure
description: Using Azure Machine Learning’s MLOps capabilities, students will gain experience in understanding ML models, protecting people and their data, and controlling the end-to-end ML lifecycle at scale.
skills_learnt: Azure ML user management , Azure data services , AI business context , Azure ML platform

reviews.content: Practical based and useful
Going well so far. Project reviewers seem to be very personable, and makes sure what is taught is actually applied.

The program for me is going fine. I have getting the knowledge I expected at the beginning of the project. Nevertheless the labs and this first project seems to be not well prepared in some aspects. I have had issues (I have to say that it has been like a kind of 'reality bite' as it is likely to face it in real world applications) with the first project that make me feel really uncomfortable and fustrated because the knowledge I was supposed to apply was there but I was not getting the results I would like because of compatibility problems among the different libraries in the training and the notebook environments. Luckily a mentor, after seeing my evolutions with the problem, figured out a possible solution and it worked but I lost a week trying to find out what was happening.
excellent
So far so good, I am enjoying Azure ML.
Just completed the first project. So far the program is great with a lot of hands-on exercises and demos!
expected the same as the original AWS SageMaker version, but this program is a different approach and complements past programs.  great intro to autoML
Feedback is really go to the point and aim for learner improvement !
Great
I love this way of learning because I can firmly grow on this basis.
Incredible. I found the FAQ sessions very helpful when doing the course

It was such a great experience training both ml models using hyperdrive and autuml. I have learned a lot. The first review received was also incredible and added a ton of value in my learning experience. The downsides was that the template code from the project was missing some important information that I had to search by my own and also deprecated parameters. Perhaps some updates in the sense would be good. Also provide more details in how to save the machine learning model trained with hyperdrive would be welcome.
So far greatüôÇ
Good enough. I enjoyed. More better if we can try creating Auto ML UI tools too in the project. As we might be requested to do so in the real life.

The program is challenging but workable. I appreciate the practical exercises in the Azure Machine Learning Studio and SDK, though experiments and runs are very time consuming. Thanks for recommendation in my project evaluation.

The program itself is comprehensive and focuses a bit too much on selling azures features over going deep into the details of how it works exactly. A lot of the information regarding the API shown in the course is completely outdated, so you will have to do a lot of your own research into what currently works if you want to do the projects. A good aspect is that you are given a generous amount of lab time on azure, which is the best way to learn the platform. The labs are timed, but you can create another VM from fresh to do it again once it expires, so you can practice a lot and get a good feel for how the platform works.
In this program, is a little difficult because i dont working with azure but is very facinating
The instruction is clear but it doesn't seem to prepare us too much for the projects. Having example code would help so we know how the AzureML Python SDK modules and classes interoperate
Great

The content itself I think is ok to get an overall view of a ML pipeline, but the use of Microsoft Azure makes it difficult to follow due to the excessive time needed just to enter to the platform, specially for those that only have available 30-45 minutes day. Many times I have been waiting more than 15 minutes just to enter in. And if authentication process fails and a manual set up is needed, then your daily schedule would have been dedicated just to this.
Thank you for the review. It is goign very well and I cant wait to finish it. I'm focusing on AzureML and I would like to advance my career in this field.
Good program for learning how to operationalize machine learning solutions.
very helpful
the Project was very good, but i think more Visual Studio it's better for this project.
It is being more difficult for me than I thought.

I put 4 stars not 5 for two reasons : - I've submitted the first project and it was not reviewed after 72 hours . i was planinng to finish the program in one month but finaly that was not possible so i decided to cancel . the reason is that i paid for other programs and i wish to subscribe for other interesting programs and it is so expensive for my i don't have a budget for . -  important parts need to be included in this course . the data drift as well as the deployment of a webservice apication using Azure and third part services . i think that the content is still poor from a complete ML engineer program
Kind of
It is directly applicable to the work I am undertaking at work.
Amazing, as a Alumini i can say that's challenge.
Going well, but is taking me a while to complete.
It was good. Overall experience was also good with this course except Lab Access.
Overall program is good but if we have more content on hyper parameter and different model parameters details would be great.
In the beginning, I'm not sure to have all the skill to proceed with this course but the course itself gives me all the information to learn this new discipline.
It matches 100% of my expectations cause I already have an ML background, an immense love for DevOps. Merging my skills to be an MLOps engineer is a dream that came to the light. Thank you
Great content and the projects are very challenging!
Great

It was very interesting, anyway I believe lessons are too short and don't explain the whole subject of the lessons.  Also provided material is insufficient, mainly link to documentation were provided, I was expecting something more like books or dedicated articles from the teachers.  It seems the above issues are also in the third module.
Great learning experience with the project review

I think that loading the workspace every time in a virtual machine is taking the focus from the lesson/concept. Its hard to have a long learning session. I ended up using my personal enterprise subscription in order to avoid the vms.
It is tough nut projects are very practical and gives a lot of good working experience. Mentor support is excellent, they are very quick to respond
The program is going great! I am 10 days ahead of my schedule and the project was really challenging. I appreciate all the good feedback I have received.

As always, love the projects and the reviews. Also this nanodegree I'm making more use of the questions to mentors. The structure of the course is good.  The Lab is a nightmare, using my own Azure account is much easier (and costs are not so high). A setup with distributing accounts that have $100 worth of training for the duration of the course would have been preferred.  Also I find the video's a bit too much hype. Would prefer it more fact based.
The program is great, however the environment to develop is not. Only during the project I could find a way to use my local PC connected to Azure Cloud to have a proper development environment.
All Udacity programs are incredible, this one too is very good.
So far the course was quite interesting. In particular the possibility of hands-on exercises was a lot of fun since it required a lot of debugging and trying things out.
feels more like an advertisement than a program to be honest. But still it's good to learn these skills

I find the program sufficiently challenging and very interesting. Help is within reach if one gets stuck on something. I especially liked the first project, which is the only one I've done so far. It helped me with learning the concepts a lot.
the material is great and it has been fun to learn, the first project I found quite challenging but so far everything has been really great experienced. I like the personalised review process
It is most definitely tough in my experience here at Hogwarts, but will be worth the ride.
Grate program. I would like to get more reading information.
Its great.

Overall, the quality is good! Explanations in videos are clear and precise.  They are a lot of errors in the starter code provided (clean_data, serve.py etc). It can be misleading for a newbie in Python.  The environment labs are painful, perhaps it could be good to obtain credits from Microsoft so that everyone with the Nanodegree can do on his subscription?  I have mixed feelings about the screencast requirement, I don't think this is needed in the workplace at all.  8/10!
The program matches very well my needs. This is exactly what I was looking for. I have a Machine Learning and and NLP nano degrees, so I know your programs very well.

The content is very good. The projects given were also very good. The timeline needs to be a little more flexible for projects as they are not very straight forward. I had to access the lab multiple times and run the code to get the right answer.
Awesome

title: Cloud Developer using Microsoft Azure
description: This program teaches how to deploy, build, migrate, and monitor applications on Azure, thereby preparing learners for success on Microsoft’s AZ-204 Azure Developer Associate Expert certification
skills_learnt: Cloud migration , Cloud security in Azure , Microservices architecture basics , Azure monitor

reviews.content: So far it's going well
Its going great. I like it very much, especially that you have external resources, documents & links for almost any topic.
Lower content level than expected, especially based on requirements for the course. As a whole though, good course and very detailed and up to date content.
I could get a grasp of the db and app flow effectively. Thank you.
The program is good. I've learned a lot so far.
Yes, it was good practice to understand Azure. Thanks a lot!
for now it is in my expectations. The only improvements i wish is on the excercises that need to be more accurate
Fantastic. A great learning by putting into practice in various ways the access and creation of different services in Azure.

So far a really great course.  It's always tough to find a balance between making people write code for themselves vs. giving enough starter code to make the class possible on a reasonable timeline... I think Udacity strikes a good balance.  The first project was very applicable and aligned well to my goals for the course.
I already have some familiarity with Azure.  I wonder if I would have been lost without a little prior knowledge.

Content is good overall, but the Azure Performance course needs to be revised so there is better explanation and the flow is more logical. There was surprisingly little focus on security, which seems like it should be included.
Yes, even though it's a little too much easy.
Thanks for the review
It's been going well so far. I struggled a bit with logging. I wish I had quick access to a mentor, face to face.

The program did match my expectations. Best part is to work on the project. The review was so detailed and personalized. I felt that all my effort (even the tiny things) were looked at and acknowledged. That is enough to keep me going and to confidently complete the course.
Really good project!
That was amazing and at least for me was great
I think the program is awesome. There's so much to learn about Azure. I hope this program gives me the foundation I need to keep learning!
This program is very nice. I think, it will be nice if similar program can be offered with Java.  There are so many Java folks who might get help from it.

The 1st course which is related to VMs, App Service, Storage, OAuth and Azure SQL Database is good, however the content is not complete and there are some mistakes that could be reviewed. I think the instruct could've given more details on videos. It was vague sometimes and I needed to look for on the web to grab more information. The Help tool is great and it helps a lot.
was expecting a more broad coverage. Also be great if the code was explained in detail for those not familiar with flask
Praxis relevant and cool videos with good explanation. I think it is not good to explain it by using a mac system as there are way more users using windows systems compared to mac systems.
It is going great so far, I am learning many things
Its amazing, all is very clear and interesting. You have to dive deeper due to all services Azure has but, at the moment I recommend it 100%.

I thought in the beginning that this would be like many  other MOOCs but honestly, the content and the challenge in Udacity is superior  I felt engaging throughout the first module  These are more practice based than teaching . In contrast to other platforms, I found these courses to be less and short lectures and more practical work  The fact that human mentors evaluate the work, I think this is by far the best MOOC platform even though I feel like the courses are priced high . I enrolled in discount offer , so I feel good

title: Growth Product Manager
description: In this Nanodegree, you will learn to build acquisition funnels, identify core customers, and optimize growth loop models.
skills_learnt: Product monetization metrics , Product monetization strategy , Growth loops , Target personas
prerequisites: Market segmentation , Product KPIs , Basic descriptive statistics

reviews.content: good, very insightful. It is very hard to do some exercise online, because sometime we need to discuss directly to understand
Expectations exceeded and a great intro into Growth Product Mgt for someone with looking to take his experience of growth strategy into tech.
It has been enlighting and provided an upskilling platform. I would say its more complex than expected but with continuous practice it will easen.
Practical exercise. Well-designed syllabus.
Going good. There are some inconsistencies in naming between the exercise doc and the lesson section names that make it a little jarring to go back and forth. But, otherwise good.
It would be great to add some real case study.
So far so good
The course provides nice framework. It'd be nice to add more real world example or feedback from the real stakeholders towards this framework.
I'm really enjoying the course!
perfect so far
It's going really nice
Hello, The most likable thing about Udacity is concise Videos and rigorous project work.
This program exceeded my expectations in the path of becoming a Groth Product Manager. I consider all the lessons have great value and amazing insights to take into account during this journey.
I really like the program! Quite a lot of new material and an interesting projects!
This program is intense and the curators have done a lot to simulate the real-world experiences of a GPM. Thanks a lot to the Udacity team!
It has matched my expectations and needs. The growth loop theory was explained extremely well and thoroughly from end to end.
Yes - been great so far thanks
So far so good. I am enjoying using case studies to give real world context.
I'm over the moon. This course was too enlightening and suitable for my job
It was very interesting - More challenging than some of the previous courses i have made
Getting what I want from the program
Thank you
The program is going amazing. Yes, learning a lot.

The program is challenging, as expected. I have long exposure to Product Growth, in Zero to One environments, as well as Product Management, nonetheless I did pursue this program in order to formalize my skills and sharpen them. The program offers fain a holistic approach to take product Growth Decisions. Before going through the project, the Case Studies and Exercises offer a space to practice. The methodology introduced. Despite practicing on two case studies, prior to doing the project, the tasks are time intensive and takes time to perform. This output based approach trains the learner to be a practitioner.

title: Digital Transformation for Business Leaders
description:
Digital Transformation for Business Leaders offers a customized learning journey for business leaders to define what digital transformation means to their organizations, to evaluate how emerging technologies will generate value to their business, and to calibrate the most relevant organizational strategies to embark on their own roadmap for digital transformation. 

Learners customize the lessons that best fit their learning goals. They create a roadmap that defines digital goals and execution strategies for their team/organization, as well as a talent transformation plan to set their employees on learning journeys tailored to those specific strategies.
skills_learnt: Digital transformation strategy , Organizational change management

title: Cloud Native Application Architecture
description: In this program, students will learn to run and manage scalable applications in a cloud native environment, using open source tools and projects like ArgoCD, gRPC, and Grafana.
skills_learnt: Cloud observability , Stride framework , Microservices security , Refactoring from a monolith
prerequisites: Basic web development , Unix shell , Hashicorp vagrant

reviews.content: Very good, and close to my needs :)

The material thus far has been great; the project reinforces lessons and exercises. Concepts like kubernetes, argocd and helm require much more exploration and practice to fully appreciate them; while this requires personal initiative, the lesson could help by adding a couple of projects/exercises e.g., deploying projects on multiple clusters, using helm to install applications, using load balancers, complex deployments and such.

So far the courses are going great.  The second project seemed more difficult than it should have been as it was easy to come up with a poor architecture and then make the implementation difficult.  The first course was my favorite course I've ever taken at Udacity.  She did a great job teaching the usage of kubernetes!
absolutely matched, but I'd like to have a choise between Java and Python
On this particular instance yeah great content
Excellent
Till now the project and course has given me a lot of value.

So far it is exactly as I had hoped, good video tutorials and learning material mixed with practical hands on exercises and projects that are challenging. The review system for the project is the most detailed review of any online learning platform I have used - its really top class.
nice, learn a lot
I am learning real-life skills that I can apply on the job, not just theoretical jargon.
I really learned a lot doing actual coding
I'm really enjoying it so far.
Learned a ton about Kubernetes, ArgoCD, etc. Very excited

I am very excited about this project. Although I was familiar with most of the concepts before starting this course, I am learning a whole new suite of technologies through this course, which is very exciting!
The first part of the course was amazing
I found this program meets my expectation of understanding fundamentals of cloud services focusing on deployment techniques and principles.
Really cool program, the kubernetes was exactly what I was looking for
Yes. It has matched my needs and expectations.
I'm very excited with results.
Great learning experience. Tutorials are good, precise and to the point. Additional links in each lessons are very helpful.
Well done
Building it from end to end is very helpful in understanding the process.
It is great, I learnt much more than I expected with this lesson!

This is a great course to quickly get a handle on the basics required for Cloud Native Applications. I thought the material could be a little more in-depth into the details of individual tools, but the assignments that address GitOps provide a practical introduction. I look forward to the next course.
great so far
This has been a great learning experience. I've been able to get my hands dirty with using kubernetes.
Awesome! Best ND experience for me, so far. Katie Gamanji really put together an amazingly compact yet broad fundamentals course. Amazing!
Having worked with containers for a while, I learned a lot of new things.
This nano-degree program is one of the best online courses I have seen since 2016
So far this Nanodegree is fulfilling my expectations ! Its awasome !

The real value is in the projects. The course sufficiently prepares you to achieve the project goals. Guided tasks are a big help, they save a lot of time (otherwise spent usually not learning very much) - as full time employed learner I really appreciate that.
The first project was extremely good. I would have shown also kustomize  The reviews were also really very good.
GREAT
Good.

For me, I have this obsession with building scalable systems that can handle the load from many users, so learning cloud technologies is a must. I was quite surprised at how good the curation of the course is on tools and best practices in the cloud-native sector.  I think the course provides me with the foundational knowledge I need to continue my journey on building scalable systems to solve challenging real-world problems.

title: Programming for Data Science with R
description: This Programming for Data Science with R Nanodegree program provides an overview of data analysis and programming. In the SQL course, students learn to use SQL to answer complex business problems, including basic commands, joins, and aggregations. In the R course, students learn programming fundamentals and topics such as data types, functions, loops, and conditional statements. They learn to read and manipulate data in R, create basic visualizations, and perform statistical analysis. The version control course teaches students to use Git and GitHub to manage versions of programs and collaborate with others. These courses include practical projects where students use their skills to analyze real data.
skills_learnt: Control flow in r , R data structures , R function definition , Data structures

reviews.content: It was a little difficult but there were a good explanation. It helps me a lot.
great

The project was fun and I appreciated the rubric so I did not have to guess at the expectations. The review feedback was helpful as well as very quick.
The project is challenging, but I improve my critical thinking and learning skills through the project!

title: Cloud DevOps using Microsoft Azure
description: This program teaches students how to deploy, test, and monitor cloud applications on Azure, thereby preparing learners for success on Microsoft’s AZ-400 DevOps Engineer Expert certification.
skills_learnt: Software performance testing , Functional testing , Test environments , Logging

reviews.content: Very well structured, truth is i struggled a bit with the Azure end of it during the first assignment.   Problably should have as a pre-requisit at least a bit of knowledge about Azure before diving into Devops (or a better intro to Azure in the nano degree).  Overall feel like i'm learning a lot.
really enjoying learning things that are new to me about DevOps!
learning what I need to for my job,  a little challenging, would prefer more examples
Well it is not enough information to have a full undrstanding. I had to take other courses to go more in deeph. Probably you should consider add more material and labs before the project.
good.
It helped to put together each aspect of Infrastructure as code and provided clear understanding of Azure Infra components
Good good.
it is great
Lectures are good but they needed to be more beginner oriented.
The program is very useful and provides lots of new learning on Terraform and Packer. The project is very well designed covering good landscape of concepts in Packer, TF, DevOps and Azure.

So far its fine, but I really feel like a lot of crucial content is getting gleamed over. Networking for example is such a mysterious concept to many people and this would have been a great opportunity to delve a little bit deeper into it.
So far good. Learning new things in Azure.
project was nice
Very good insight

The program is going good but there are issues faced in the other projects such as CI-CD with selenium. The support/creators of this program should first try to do this project themselves to ensure people dont face serious bottlenecks.  We are working professional and cannot keep waiting/working on same tasks for weekls. Its really frustrating at times.

So far pretty good! I like how you guys break it down to manageable chunks that I can work through. Although I am experienced in Analytics and Tech, I wouldn't consider myself anywhere near Infrastructure Operations tasks and generally tasks on a console. So great job in giving me a challenge, without overwhelming me :)
First project was really challenging. I practiced and learnt a lot. I started to like DevOps tools

The program is going great as I have expected it. I'm really enjoying how the material is structured and presented and the hands-on approach of the exercises. I have really learned a lot during the first project and I'm absolutely excited to continue in the program.

I'm progressing well - partially had more troubles in getting the basic system up and running than with the content.  Maybe a suggestion would be to 'suggest a desired setting' for execution of the programm.

I am enjoying this program.  It has provided ample information about the material, provides enough examples to get started, and pushes a student to apply the lessons for a real world use case.  Similar to a real world position, there is no hand-holding and students must dive into the material to be successful.
The program is more than perfect. The most interest thing is it is well-organized and projects are from real world
just as expected
The program is really Hands-on and really requires a lot of dedication and this produces true experience.
It's challenging but enjoyable
It's going well so far. I loved the first project and course materials. We'll see!
I love how challenging it is and most importantly, how much new skills i am aquiring
Good so far. I am starting to look at jobs and realising that I meet the job requirements.
Yes and no, I think the project I personally could of used a little more direction and if there was a way to get a hold of someone to clarify the project requirements that would be amazing.
interesting and good
It is going good

Excellent content, I learned many new things.  Some times I feel lost but eventually i figure it out.  I have almost finished the second project, I have to make the presentation video. It would be more useful to mention the rubric at the start of the course. I have to repeat everything from the start in order to record the process.  I expected to find more .NET content (C# or VB.NET) but python is also fine.  I can easily develop an app in any programming language but many students may need .NET programming skills if they decide to work in a programming team that uses Microsoft software development tools.
The program is going well for me. So far I am satisfied with the program curriculum and the end of the module project
The first project is good and hands-on
Program is worth the cost and very helpful.

Hi Course is amazing! I thought that course will packed with more exercises, especially when it comes to tuning of image with packer, configuration of image... (busybox httpd &... it is not enough ;))  Thank You!

This is my first Udacity course and it exceeds all my expectations so far! I really enjoy it. What I especially appreciate is what I call the 'digest approach' when introducing new complex technologies:  1. 'This is what it basically is, dont worry about the details for now.' This helps my focus. 2. Minimal example that lets me see the benefit of using such technology immediately. 3. Expanding a bit more but not in an overwhelming way. 4. Providing links and recommending resources so I can explore deeper if want to.
Curriculum is well made. All aspects are wonderfully covered with extra references. I would have hoped for more depth of understanding and examples in azure policies and terraform
I'm happy with the Course Material and Help provided. Thank you

Lot's of concepts covered by the project that weren't covered in the lesson. If students lack a strong background with Information Architecture, Cloud Computing, Virtural Machines, Google Search and general developer knowledge (stack overflow, interpreting requirements/documentation etc.) this will be a lot harder to complete for them.

- great mix of technology & organization / culture - the 2nd part - infra operations - is missging some technical details in the lessons that make the project much more cumbersome than it should be. Please integrate these into the lessons: * credntials for packer, you must add envionment variables and how to get them * the inline causes 'red' lines in the packer build, how severe is this * give more guidance on how to link the packer-build-image into the main.tf, that information was very hard to find. I did not get it in the web but by chance found it in the knowledge sections. It's not the end of the world, but the information is so crucidal, it should be in the lesson! * give more dirctions with the load-balancer and how it must be done in terraform and Azure; if you are not senior in web-technology, it's hard to reason what and why resources must be created.  * the project could be more satifying if one would actually deploy a static webside and be able to see it in the browser by going to the load-balancer's public IP; I would want to see this instead of researching for the right way to define the custom image in main.tf.

I think it is really a good one, may be my timing will not work for me as i thought it will because of personal reasons and probably make it difficult on time.... ...using terraform was not friendly and messy for me, it will be good if more is explained in the future ...i also thought wrongly the free azure subscription will stay till i use the $200, but it seems lost it since i could not use the whole month for the course work, may be some info on that to for future users ....it is very interesting to me and i will try my best, whenever i get time to go through my introduction to many of these new things, as time and inconvenience allows me    thank you

The course provides the in-depth knowledge of DevOps methodology and real-life practical labs. I used to register individual classes. Although the concept was there, I cannot piece everything together. Recommend for who search for DevOps training class!
Good project!
Fantastic.
Little basic level & great content. It might need to be a little in-depth regarding IaC.
Good
Hands-on Practice, Clarity in delivery of instructions.
Great ! I learned a lot
Yes the curriculum is good and up to date. Getting prompt assistance from mentors
I like this program. I always wanted to learn about DevOps so I got the chance. I hope that the program will help me further in my working life .
perfectly

title: Discovering Business Analytics
description: Business analytics is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. This course will introduce you to some basic concepts and terms that you'll need to step into business analytics.

title: Discovering Data Analysis and Visualization
description: Data analysis and visualization is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this course, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts and terms that you'll need to step into this world.

title: Ethical Hacker
description: This program will equip students with the skills they need to advance in their security career and become an Ethical Hacker or Penetration Tester.
