title: Data Science for Business Leaders
description: The Data Science for Business Leaders Executive Program equips learners with strategic, human capital, and technical requirements to deliver enhanced business outcomes and develop an organizational data science strategy that unlocks this potential. The course consists of four lessons that provide a broad introduction to data science and what it can do for a business, articulation of a business's strategic objectives, the human capital component of data science, and creating a data and data architecture strategy. The program also includes a capstone project where students prepare a 100-day data science plan for a company of their choosing.
skills_learnt: Data science strategy , Data science business context , Project risk mitigation , Data and data architecture strategy

reviews.content: It was indeed a rich and productive experience. An excellent introductory program on Data Science applied to a business context.

The program contains a lot of useful information. It is lacking in projects however. There is only one project, and the other exercises are not graded. There were also some inconsistencies within the material. Still, I am likely to reference the material in the future. I feel more small projects would have helped solidify the learning.

This program is a hands-on approach to deliver concrete results. I like the 100-day roadmap especially the projects identification and opportunity matrix. It gives also some good tips to ensure data science is endorsed at the highest level of the organization to avoid failure. The videos and mini exercises are also of great help!
Very good.
excellent, and the resources and references are great
the program is great. it met my expectations
the overall program is great, it can create reminders but also flexibility. The task to create a project is very helpful for me to implement on my work

Very Much, I hoped only for one online session to discuss my project directly with the mentor or whom responsible for reviewing my exam. it would be very difficult I know. but it would be very helpful
It has been going so well: all the submissions and reviews really helped me understand fully the impact of the project.
Great to start with Data Science basics...
Excellent
The program met my expectations. Some parts of the program were tough but the pointers given for further reading was excellent
I would highly recommend this program!
Good overview of data science

This is an amazing strategy-focused executive program. To take the most out of this program you should get involved with experts in the different areas within your company so you can use the capstone project for your own.
App Perfect! Great experience
It was good, it has matched to great extent of my requirements

I really liked the program. I loved the human resource planning. I need did something like this. It made me feel like a real company builder. To create a 100 day plan is an amazing idea, i feel comfortable to use this for every company I will join. Especially planing my own 100-days, what real cool idea to think about. Never did something like that.  I think the is potential for improvement in methods and examples which type of projects there are how much time to calculate. It was hard for me to predict scope, timeframe and costs for the projects. I would love to see some examples, to feel more comfortable with my estimations on evaluating data science projects. All in a all. A great course and with amazing feedback by the mentors on my project. Greate value for my money. Thank you. :-)
I found the content of this course to be on high quality, practically applicable, and thought provoking. The capstone project is very useful in that it is directly applicable to the work setting.
This was great.
The course has breadth, I just wished we could go a little bit deeper by seeing a sample presentation for an already completed project , perhaps after project submission.

Awesome program, thank you so much for putting all these topics into a clear and concise framework! I've been reading to many articles about so many of the topics covered, but did not have a clear big picture on how to start things off so far. The course walks you through exactly that, lets you learn and put everything together in the capstone project. Thumbs up!
Program is simple to understand and has good mix of technology and strategy required for data science leadership role.

The program was informative, interesting, instructional and revealing to me. I learnt a lot from the processes involved in identifying and prioritising data science opportunities. I learnt a lot about the importance of data-driven culture and how to go about implementing the strategy.  Thanks
The program is a great addition to the education portfolio of any business leader to get a high-level overview of all they need to know about Data Science.

Hi Udacity,  Congratulations on you're very comprehensive class, kudos!  All in all it was well done, easy to follow and difficult project that I spent many weekends on.  I found the first review not specific enough but  figured it out in the end.  The rest was  tough enough, not all answers are provided in te course but that's ok because we had to search for it.  Thank you, Maria

It is a really good guidance on how to assess data science projects and make them comparable. You will learn that this is the basis to schedule a roadmap, configure the required team skills and data architecture.   For data science experts this really helps to view on projects with a business perspective. For business experts without data science foreknowledge the data science lessons may not enough to understand the different data science and machine learning concepts. At the end I hoped to learn a little more about hardware-architectural requirements (computing power relative to data size and amount etc.), which is not included in this course.
The only thing I though is that the lessons are bigger than this.

The course gives a good overview. However, general and rather already known topics (agile / waterfall or building organizations / cultural pitfalls) are described very broadly, whereas from my point of view important topics (IT architecture, data science / ML methods) are very short. After ML for business leaders (a very good course) I expected more from this course. Ideally, both courses should be more closely coordinated.
I enjoyed the asynchronous nature and manageable time options The information is timely and useful for learning the subject matter Additional links to more information was helpful  Thank you

It's a very nice high level overview on to create a strategy to explore data and transform organizations towards a data-driven culture. My experience also endorses me to say this is absolutely feasible and exciting.
About what I expected. Enjoyed it.
Its a wonderful program. I do highly recommend this program for executive/business leaders.
Great experience, learned a lot
It‚Äôs was amazing and valuable.
Pretty good
Am Mc-Loving this! I really LOVE Udacity! Keep on having more Nanodegrees and more REAL LIFE projects please
It is a good program but could be more clearer with more example. It serve well as a high level point of view for the data-driven architecture course.
This course give me understanding how to use data science in business and strategy to apply business
I have some experience working on the ground on the data science projects. This course really helped me to re-think what I have done from top-down approach, to help me connect the low level dots.
I really liked the program and learned a lot. Although I thought it to be a little bit more into detail.
good, the project doc Vs pptx could need some refinement. There is a bit of a duplicate effort needed!
Great platform and organization. I would like to have more examples / see more projects out of the industry. Thanks!
So far so good!
It is really helpful, lot of information to learn. Maybe more glossary files or easier to search the titles or so when working on project
high praise!
It is going great and has met my expectations.

To a certain extent it has. I believe the time duration for this course should be increased as it is targeting working professionals who may not be able to meet the deadlines as initially chalked out.
I think the framework provided here makes us think deeply about all aspects of data science before we come up with a robust strategy
Program has been good. Mostly meet expectations, other than a few areas that were a little to surface level and did not get into detail as much as I would have hoped.
The course was great! Easy to follow and the template was awesome! Will definitely become useful in the future.
I love this program!

I was expecting a bit more interaction. It's basically watching videos, completing exercises for yourself (not reviewed by peers or lecturers), and then submitting a final project. I was not fully clear about the structure and curriculum of the course. The project got rated very quickly and I received positive feedback. Overall, I learned many things about data science.
It's very accurate data and it was a great course
excelente
It was a little less technical than I expected. I had hoped for more technical insights and challenges.
I think it needs more explaining content But I enjoyed it and it adds a lot to my knowledge and skills Thanks
Fantastic
Great program structure with and useful content!

In a short time this program enabled me to get a better and in-depth insight into Data Science from a managerial perspective. Especially the capstone project forced me to apply the knowledge and insights from the course to my situation and organization, which created an extra dimension in my learning.

title: Security Engineer
description: You’ll master the foundational skills necessary to become a Security Engineer. This program will focus on how to protect a company’s computer systems, networks, applications and infrastructure.
skills_learnt: Static application security testing , Software development lifecycle , Owasp top-10 , Logging
prerequisites: Basic Linux , Computer networking basics , Windows operating system

reviews.content: The program is going very well.
Perfect
Nice project.
i would like to learn more about the career services help

Thanks for that great learning experience. The course material is very well structured and the tutors have both a very deep knowledge as subject matter experts as well as a real dedication. I have really enjoyed the course so far and -what's more important- I have already learned something which helps my doing a better job.
Good. I finished the Introduction to CyberSec course a month before starting this one, so Lesson 2 was repetitive, a disclaimer and the option to skip it would be nice.
I am really loving it and feeling that I am where I belong - home.
It's a great program. I have learned so much and it makes difficult concepts clear and easy to understand. It has matched my needs and exceeded my expectations.

It was a great expirience. I already made some threat analysis for applications in the past and have learned some new stuff which I will translate into actions for my current job.  I am looking forward to the last part of the nanodegree, hands on application securitytesting is what I do and what I like. The start looks really promising. I really like the fast and constructive feedback.
I really enjoy this program, and love the flexibility of it. I am usually busy with my work as a DevOps Engineer, and the flexibility of Udacity really does come in handy.
I am happy to pass the first project.
yes it is very good so far

Good!!!

title: Data Analysis and Visualization Fluency
description: Learn about the data analysis process, key steps in data wrangling, basic data types, summary statistics, how to design good data visualizations, common types of charts and plots, and how to tell a story with your visuals.

title: Discovering Data Literacy
description: Data literacy is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts and terms that you'll need to step into the world of data literacy.

title: Introduction to Python
description: Learn Python programming fundamentals such as data types and structures, variables, loops, and functions.
skills_learnt: NumPy , Pandas , Control flow , Python scripting

title: Cloud Architect using Microsoft Azure
description: This program will teach you how to become an Azure Cloud Architect, build a migration plan to migrate from on-premises to the Azure Cloud, and apply automation, high availability, and backup/recovery skills to the role of an Azure Cloud Architect, Cloud Server Engineer, Azure Security Engineer, DevOps Engineer, and more.
skills_learnt: Cloud cost policies , Cloud cost evaluation , Automated cloud cost optimization , Azure security center
prerequisites: Azure compute service , Azure development , Computer networking basics

title: Introduction to Data
description: Learn the basic concepts of data analysis and descriptive statistics. Learn how to manipulate, analyze and visualize data in Excel and Google Sheets. Learn about business metrics across a wide range of business areas (marketing, sales, growth and finance). Finally, learn about forecasting sales and financial metrics.
skills_learnt: Basic spreadsheet use , Business KPIs , Basic descriptive statistics , Spreadsheet functions

title: Digital Project Management
description: Digital Project Management enables the creation and development of online content, products, and services that help companies stay in business and grow. A digital project manager leverages digital tools to coordinate projects so they get done on time and within a budget, while satisfying the underlying needs of the business and its customers. The key skills you will learn from Digital Project Management Nanodegree include translating business requirements into a project scope statement, building project plans in Waterfall or Agile, and developing a high-performing team. The Digital Project Management Nanodegree teaches foundational concepts and common methods used today. It’s a fast-growing field that impacts a wide range of industries, including retail, media, and technology.
skills_learnt: Cost-benefit analysis , Project risk mitigation , Scrum , S.M.A.R.T. goals

reviews.content: The Digital Project Management Nanodegree helped to develop a workflow when managing projects. The course outlined the tools and processes needed to help future project managers capitalize off their knowledge in this area.
The program was great. I learned a lot.  Thank you.
really useful to get an idea how project management woks
Highly recommended

The program is compact yet it covers all aspect I need to understand and start the journey of the digital project management. Specifically, I really like the course exercises and final project which provide great practical materials to plan and manage digital projects in real life.

title: Introduction to AI/ML Fluency
description: In this course, you will learn fundamental topics of artificial intelligence and machine learning. You will learn about what they are, different algorithms/methods, and their applications.

title: Data Engineering with Microsoft Azure
description: Learn to design data models, build data warehouses, build data lakes and lakehouse architecture, create data pipelines, and work with large datasets on the Azure platform using Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Data Factory.
skills_learnt: Database fundamentals , Cassandradb , PostgreSQL , Database normalization
prerequisites: Command line interface basics , Relational data models , Intermediate Python

title: Business Analytics Fluency
description: In this course, you will learn fundamental topics of business analytics. You will learn how to use data to drive business decisions and solve business problems.

title: Discovering Agile
description: Agile is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this course, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts and terms that you'll need to step into the world of agile.

title: Discovering Cybersecurity
description: Get your start in the high-growth field of cybersecurity by learning the basic principles and concepts used to keep systems safe.

title: How to Use ChatGPT Fluency
description: This learning experience will guide you through using ChatGPT, a large language model developed by OpenAI.  You'll gain in-depth knowledge of the underlying technology that powers ChatGPT and master the art of prompt design while exploring its capabilities, limitations, and training.  Whether you're a digital professional, AI enthusiast, or an aspiring AI practitioner, this course equips you with the skills to craft effective prompts, generate high-quality responses, and interpret the outputs of the model. Through industry-relevant hands-on practice, you'll learn to harness ChatGPT's conversational AI capabilities to generate content, analyze data, and create nuanced AI tools.

title: Data Science Fluency
description: Learn the data science process, including how to build effective data visualizations, and how to communicate with various stakeholders.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: The goal of the Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Nanodegree program is to equip software developers with the engineering and operational skills required to build automation tools and responses that ensure designed solutions respond to non-functional requirements such as availability, performance, security, and maintainability. The content will focus on both designing systems to automate response to issues with software sites as well as how to respond to common on-call situations.
skills_learnt: Toil reduction , Data recovery , Site reliability engineering business context , Deployment automation

title: Discovering Cloud Computing
description: This course will give you the basic information you need to understand the fundamentals of cloud computing, including cloud services and cloud storage.

title: Programming with Python Fluency
description: Learn basic programming with Python, one of the most versatile and widely used programming languages! This course will introduce you to core programming concepts and fundamental Python syntax by writing code to make a virtual "turtle" robot draw colorful shapes on the screen.

title: Security Analyst
description: The goal of the Security Analyst Nanodegree Program is to equip students with the skills required to be successful in an analyst role.
skills_learnt: Intrusion detection systems , Threat modeling , Splunk , Security information and event management
prerequisites: Basic Python , IT architecture diagramming , Database design

reviews.content: Exciting
Great so far. The lessons are quite good and very informative.
Awesome reviewer.
The program is going great, I'm learning more about cybersecurity than I have my entire career as a network engineer.

Excellent program and great instructors. The project feedbacks are very detailed and personalized which helped me to know where I need to improve and allowed us to resubmit our project to ensure everything is done correctly.  Thank you.  However, I felt the first part seems more like networking related subjects. If the students without basic networking knowledge will be hard to understand the VLAN, DMZ and networks setup concept, so it requires devote much more time to complete the first project. I would recommend to add basic networking knowledge as one of  prerequisites for this program or provide another basic course for networking to help those students to learn even better from Security Aanlyst program. Thank you.
Program is going well so far. Learning a lot and finding the exercises encouragingly challenging.

1. I love the way how you are teaching: Short videos, lots of exercises, the big project. 2. I appreciate the fact that the project is close to real work for a real company. This is a very good preparation for professional life.
Its going pretty well so far.
It is difficult but the project review really helped me to understand the subject. I like it.
Its going awesine

This is beyond my expectation. This training gave me a lot of hands-on in the cyber security field. This is  what I the type of program I was looking for after I completed my CompTIA Security +. I will strongly recommend this program to anyone .
Very nice
Great feedback so far on the projects. Enjoy the practical way of using knowledge and quick response.
It is going great, learning good and new things about security. Really excited to see the upcoming lessons.
Its going good. I am happy to pass the first project.
It is one of the greatest course in Udacity. I have joined into Google as Security Engineer after graduating from the course.
It helps me a lot!
I was expecting something more technical but is good, and the project was interesting, not easy, and fun.

So far the program has met my expectations. It is well structure and with a logical flow. I think it would be important to have 2 or 3 videos explaining the solution(s) to the projects to see how each of the student did versus a 'Real World' project of the same kind.
Program has been great! Learnt a lot!
It is one of the greatest course in Udacity. I have joined into Google as Security Engineer after graduating from the course.

title: Agile Fluency
description: In this course, you will be introduced to The Agile Mindset and how it sets the tone for "Being" Agile versus just "Doing" Agile. You will learn to leverage The Agile Manifesto as the foundation for all Agile Frameworks, as well as identify the practical differences between Agile and Waterfall approaches. You will then take a deep dive into Agile Teams and Governance and apply best practices of both in order to deliver immense business value. By the end of this course, you will master characteristics of three of the more popular Agile Frameworks being utilized across all industries, which are Scrum, Kanban and XP, as well as apply The Agile Manifesto to deliver practical value in Agile teams and organizations.

title: Product Management Fluency
description: The most effective products start with a comprehensive market-based, insight-driven strategy. Understand the role that product managers play during product development, with a focus on activities that happen early in the product development cycle. Learn how to identify the right problems to solve through market research, target user definition, and market sizing. Create a compelling vision and strategy that will set up the team to solve those problems. Understand how to communicate effectively to get people excited and bought into your ideas.

title: Cloud Computing for Business Leaders
description: This program will focus on the unique knowledge and skills that business leaders need to unlock the value of cloud technologies in their organizations, or enable a more cloud-native department that leverages cloud computing to drive growth and create operational efficiencies.
skills_learnt: Cloud roi , Cloud product strategy , Cloud solution evaluation , Cloud computing fluency

reviews.content: Pretty good program! Fit to what I had expected, very good!

The course was very good, the content is top-notch and the way it's explained is also very good. The course covers non-technical part of the cloud and very few courses are out there today which address the non-technical part of the cloud.
The program gave me a decent insight in the possibilities of migrating to cloud, which was what I expected.
I am honored to have been a student for this class. I have learned invaluable lessons on cloud computing that I will apply to my businesses to help my clients.
It was very interesting and helped me deepen my knowledge in the cloud.

title: Digital Freelancer
description: Master the art of digital freelancing! The program starts with the fundamentals of digital freelancing. You'll learn marketing strategies to help you stand out, including building a professional social media presence and developing an effective personal website. Next, you'll dive into the challenges of managing freelancing projects, including sourcing clients, negotiating project scopes and pricing, and effectively managing projects to completion.  You get hands-on experience building a portfolio website, and you'll practice your skills working with a mock client.
skills_learnt: Stakeholder management , Social media presence , Invoicing , Freelancing platforms

title: Discovering Product Management
description: Product management is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this course, we'll introduce you to basic concepts and terms that you'll need to step into the world of product management.

title: Go Language (Golang)
description: Students will learn the fundamentals skills, including variables, loops, data structures, functions, interfaces, structs, and maps.  Then students will use those skills to test and build an actual web server.
skills_learnt: Go Functions , Go Interfaces , Go Loops , Go Variables

title: AI Engineer using Microsoft Azure
description: The AI Engineer using Microsoft Azure Nanodegree program will equip you with the skills required to become an Azure AI engineer or an AI engineer with expertise in Azure AI and machine learning services. This program will teach you how to implement machine learning models, design and build an end-to-end AI solution with Azure Cognitive Services, and how to deploy, monitor, and manage continuous improvement of an Azure AI solution.
skills_learnt: Azure cognitive services , Azure cognitive search , Microsoft bot framework , Azure form recognizer

title: Introduction to SQL
description:
SQL is one of the most versatile tools available for extracting insights from stored data.
Learn how to execute core SQL commands to define, select, manipulate, control access, aggregate, and join data and data tables. Understand when and how to use subqueries, several window functions, and partitions to complete complex tasks. Clean data, optimize SQL queries and write select advanced JOINs to enhance analysis performance, explain which cases you would want to use particular SQL commands, and apply the results from queries to address business problems.
skills_learnt: SQL subqueries , SQL joins , SQL aggregations , SQL window functions

title: Cybersecurity Foundations Fluency
description: Security is embedded in all we do online and is a critical job skill and career field. This foundations course explains security fundamentals including core principles, critical security controls, and cybersecurity best practices. Students will also evaluate specific security techniques used to administer a system that meets industry standards and core controls, assess high-level risks, vulnerabilities, and attack vectors of a sample system, and explain ways to establish and maintain the security of different types of computer systems.

title: Security Architect
description: The goal of the Security Architect Nanodegree is to equip learners with the necessary skills required to advance their careers in the field of cybersecurity. As a security architect, you'll be charged with designing security systems to thwart malware, hacker intrusions and Denial of Service attacks. The program addresses security topics related to architectural and implementation skills required by a skilled cybersecurity professional for critical use-cases like identity & access management, infrastructure security, threat detection and incident response.
skills_learnt: Access control matrices , Network security fundamentals , Cybersecurity business context , Did framework
prerequisites: IT architecture diagramming , Systems administration proficiency , Cloud computing fluency

title: Discovering DevOps
description: This course will give you a high-level overview of some of the fundamental principles that DevOps is built on. It is intended to give you basic familiarity with the idea.

title: Discovering Digital Project Management
description: Digital Project Management is one of the most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts that you'll need to step into the world of Digital Project Management.

title: Building a Custom OpenAI Chatbot
description:
In this course, we will create a custom Q&A bot powered by OpenAI! Along the way, you'll learn how OpenAI works and how to leverage its powerful language processing capabilities to build a functional Q&A bot that can provide insightful answers to your questions and impress your friends with its knowledge.

We'll start by creating an unsupervised machine-learning workflow to match the user's question to the relevant context in our dataset. We'll use that workflow to send a custom prompt that includes this context to an OpenAI text completion model. The output will be a custom response that is better aligned with our user's need for accurate data about recent events.
skills_learnt: OpenAI API , Tokenization , Prompt Engineering , Conversational AI

title: Discovering Design Thinking
description: Design Thinking is one of the most in-demand skills. In this course, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts that you'll need to step into the world of Design Thinking.

title: Generative AI for Business Leaders
description: The Generative AI for Business Leaders course is designed to provide leaders with a framework for implementing successful AI projects and strategies in their organizations. You’ll learn how to structure your people, processes, and platforms to realize the immense potential that Generative AI holds for innovation, cost savings, and growth, and you’ll create a 100-day project roadmap for bringing Generative AI to life.
skills_learnt: Product management basics , Model performance metrics , GenAI Use Cases , Building AI Teams

title: SQL Fluency
description: SQL is one of the most versatile tools available for extracting insights from stored data. In this course, you will learn how databases work. You will also learn some basic SQL queries for that can be used to select, manipulate and aggregate data in databases.

title: Cloud Fundamentals Fluency
description: In this course, you will learn fundamental topics of cloud computing. You will learn about the main components, including their benefit and purpose.

title: Generative AI Fluency
description: This course provides a comprehensive high-level overview of Generative AI, beginning with foundational concepts and terminology and then delving into specific applications such as Large Language Models (LLMs) for text generation and diffusion-based models image creation. Key lessons include an in-depth look at LLMs, AI image generation methods, and hands-on experience with tools like DALL-E and Midjourney. The course concludes by addressing practical aspects of deploying Generative AI in production environments, focusing on data collection, prompt execution, maintenance, and orchestration strategies.

title: Discovering Programming
description: Programming is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts and terms that you'll need to step into the world of programming.

title: Statistics for Data Analysis
description: Students will learn essential skills, including describing data, understanding probability theory, designing experiments, interpreting statistical results, and applying statistical models with Python. After successfully completing this Nanodegree program, graduates will be armed with a robust foundation in statistical analysis that can be applied to Data Analyst, Business Analyst, and Data Scientist roles.
skills_learnt: Outlier analysis , Statistical sampling , Basic probability , Probability distribution
prerequisites: Basic Python , Intermediate Python , Basic arithmetic

title: Product Strategy for Product Managers
description: The most effective products start with a comprehensive market-based, insight-driven strategy. Understand the role that product managers play during product development, with a focus on activities that happen early in the product development cycle. Learn how to identify the right problems to solve through market research, target user definition, and market sizing. Create a compelling vision and strategy that will set up the team to solve those problems. Understand how to communicate effectively to get people excited and bought into your ideas.
skills_learnt: Problem validation , Product management basics , Product proposals , Stakeholder management

title: Discovering UX Design
description: UX Design is one of the most in-demand skills. In this course, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts that you'll need to step into the world of UX Design.

title: Introduction to Programming with Python I
description: Learn basic programming with Python, one of the most versatile and widely used programming languages! You'll first learn core programming concepts and fundamental Python syntax by writing code to make a virtual "turtle" robot draw colorful shapes on the screen. You'll then learn how to write Python functions, run Python from a Command-Line Interface (CLI), manipulate strings and lists, and refactor your code to improve its structure and make it more modular.
skills_learnt: Control flow in Python , Command line interface basics , Python functions , Code debugging

title: UX Design Fluency
description: Learn the fundamentals of User Experience Design.

title: Discovering Blockchain
description: Blockchain is one of the most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts that you'll need to step into the world of blockchain.

title: Enterprise Security
description: The Enterprise Security Nanodegree program imparts foundational skills in security engineering for corporate environments. Covering network and data security, endpoint protection, and application security, you will learn to design robust defenses, manage data integrity, and comply with privacy regulations, which will enhance the security posture of any enterprise.
skills_learnt: Backup strategy , Device hardening strategy , Cybersecurity policy writing , Cloud hardening strategy
prerequisites: Kali linux , Windows administration , Client-server model

title: GitHub Copilot
description: Copilot is a new service provided by GitHub that provides AI assistance to software engineers in their code editor. In this course, you'll get the opportunity to explore some of the ways Copilot can augment your development process. This course provides an overview of the technology that makes Copilot possible and you'll get the chance to practice with Copilot hands-on.

title: Business Intelligence Analytics
description: Learn what business intelligence analytics is and how enterprises use it. Learners will be introduced to how enterprises can effectively combine different data types and sources to create a sophisticated data model, and what strategies can be used to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
skills_learnt: Cluster models , Time-series analysis , Automated machine learning , Power BI Data Pipeline
prerequisites: Exploratory data analysis , Data visualization , Data wrangling

title: Data Governance
description:
In this course, you will learn how to design a data governance solution that meets your company’s needs. First, you will learn about the different types of metadata and how to build a Metadata Management System, Enterprise Data Model, and Enterprise Data Catalog. Next, you will learn how to perform data profiling using various techniques including data quality dimensions, how to identify remediation options for data quality issues, and how to measure and monitor data quality using data quality scores, thresholds, dashboards, exceptions, and trend
reports. Finally, you will learn the concepts of Master Data and golden record, different types of Master Data Management Architectures, as well as the golden record creation and master data governance processes.
skills_learnt: Master data management , Data quality assessment , Metadata management , Data governance fluency
prerequisites: ETL , Relational database basics , Basic SQL

title: Advanced Data Analysis with Power BI
description: Using Power BI, the overarching goal of the course is to help students become effective at the process of retrieving, analyzing, and visualizing data in order to answer questions and draw conclusions. After learning about descriptive and inferential statistics, histograms, linear regression, and the concepts of correlation and probability, the course moves into M, the language of Power Query to build custom formulas as part of the data transformation process.  Students then learn the language of DAX to analyze data. The final lesson of the course goes through a number of visualizations in Power BI and explores how those visuals may be used, edited, or enhanced to effectively relay information to an audience.
skills_learnt: Dax , Power query , Data fluency , Advanced data visualizations
prerequisites: Power query , Dax , Power BI Proficiency

title: Large Language Models (LLMs) & Text Generation
description: Dive deeper into how computers understand and create language, and learn how to build a custom chatbot using unsupervised machine learning, prompt engineering, and retrieval augmented generation. We'll start with a high-level overview of the types of LLMs, the differences between them, and how best to account for their strengths and weaknesses. Then we'll get into the internal details, including natural language processing (NLP) techniques like tokenization, as well as modern transformer architectures and attention mechanisms. Finally, we'll build a practical LLM application that combines an LLM with a custom dataset.
skills_learnt: Together AI API , Search implementation in Python , NLP transformers , GPT
prerequisites: Generative AI Fluency , Intermediate Python , Deep learning

title: Using SQL for Data Analysis
description:
SQL is one of the most versatile tools available when it comes to extracting insights from stored data.
Learn how to execute core SQL commands to define, select, manipulate, control access, aggregate, and join data and data tables. Understand when and how to use subqueries, several window functions, and partitions to complete complex tasks. Clean data, optimize SQL queries, and write select advanced JOINs to enhance analysis performance. Explain which cases you would want to use particular SQL commands and apply the results from queries to address business problems.
skills_learnt: SQL aggregations , SQL joins , SQL queries , SQL subqueries

title: Discovering Autonomous Systems
description: Autonomous system is one of the highest-impact, most in-demand skills. In this lesson, we'll introduce you to the fundamental concepts and terms that you'll need to step into this amazing world.

title: Digital Project Management Fluency
description: In this course, you will learn some essential and fundamental topics of digital project management. You will learn what is digital project management, when to use it, how it came to be, the business justifications of digital projects, common digital project management methodologies, and the five stages of the digital project management lifecycle.

title: Cybersecurity for Business Leaders
description: Udacity’s Cybersecurity for Business Leaders program will equip future C-suites and senior managers with practical knowledge, skills, and tools to prepare for most likely cyber threats to their digital ecosystem. They will understand the role of cybersecurity for the business and set the stage for their organization-specific response plans. Finally, leaders will prepare to make resource decisions to increase their organizational preparedness for the future.
skills_learnt: Social engineering , Cybersecurity regulations and standards , Cybersecurity training strategies , Cybersecurity incident response

title: Discovering RPA
description: In this course, we will learn the key concepts of RPA, including the history, business benefits, and application of the technology across different industries.

title: API Development and Documentation
description: In this project, you will use the skills you’ve developed to build a Trivia API. The goal of this project is to use APIs to control and manage a web application using existing data models. You’ll be given a set of data models and the application front end. Your task will be to implement the API in Flask to make the Trivia game functional.

title: Generative AI Fundamentals
description: Dive into generative AI with this course, which explores its fundamental principles and relationship to prior artificial intelligence innovations. We will walk through popular generative models and how they work, how deep learning models are developed using tools like PyTorch and Hugging Face, and finally, how to customize pre-trained open-source models for a specific use case. In the project, you will apply a cutting-edge technique called parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT), which allows for the adaptation of massive foundation models with minimal usage of computational resources.
skills_learnt: Generative AI Fluency , Image classification , Transfer learning , Training neural networks

title: Data Modeling Fluency
description: In this course, you’ll learn the fundamentals of relational and non-relational data models to fit the diverse needs of data consumers. You will also learn the basics of Big Data, which provides ways to work with massive data sets that are too large or complex to be handled by traditional data-processing application software.

title: Introduction to Javascript
description: In this course, you will use learn the basics of JavaScript! You will learn how to create and use the primary data types in JavaScript and how to use conditionals and loops to control the flow of your JavaScript code. You'll write your first JavaScript functions and you'll learn how to use arrays and objects to store collections of data. By the end of the course, you use your new JavaScript knowledge to build the core functionality of an eCommerce shopping cart.

title: Data Storytelling
description: In this course, you will learn the end-to-end process for telling a story and providing a recommendation based on data. You’ll learn to create a “ghost deck” to define a problem statement, scope possible analyses, and outline a set of potential solutions, along with next steps. You’ll also learn to identify what type of data analysis tool is appropriate for specific types of visualizations. You will learn how to identify limitations and biases in data. Lastly, you’ll learn to create a polished deck that uncovers the story from within the data through data visualizations.
skills_learnt: Data storytelling , Data limitations and biases , Problem statements , Professional presentations
prerequisites: Propositional logic , Exploratory data analysis , Basic spreadsheet use

title: Data Engineering
description: In data engineering for data scientists, you will practice building ETL, NLP, and machine learning pipelines. This will prepare you for the project with our industry partner Figure 8.
skills_learnt: scikit-learn , Data cleaning , Machine learning pipeline creation , Part of speech tagging
prerequisites: Basic SQL , Python for data science , JSON

title: RNNs and Transformers
description: This course covers multiple RNN architectures and discusses design patterns for those models.  You'll also learn about transformer architectures.
skills_learnt: Training neural networks , Backpropagation , NLP transformers , Hyperparameter tuning

title: Small Datasets in Machine Learning
description:
This learning journey is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of machine learning models and techniques specifically tailored for small datasets. 
You'll learn how to effectively utilize small datasets to build powerful models while avoiding common pitfalls associated with data scarcity. 
We'll cover methodologies and practical applications, allowing you to develop a strong foundation in machine learning techniques that apply to small dataset problems so you can successfully apply these techniques in your projects.
prerequisites: Probability and statistics , Intermediate Python , Basic machine learning

title: Intro to Web Development Fluency
description: In this course, we'll be exploring how to create web pages—and, along the way, you'll learn some important concepts about how computer languages work.

title: Ethical AI
description: In this course, students will learn how to approach and apply ethical AI. Coursework will enable practitioners to design and build models with enhanced fairness and limited bias to avoid unforeseen consequences and connect ethical AI concepts to critical issues in privacy, governance, transparency, and security. They’ll begin with acquiring ethical AI literacy skills that will enable them to engage in more meaningful discussions across AI disciplines and learn how to apply ethical AI principles to their organization. Students will then learn how to implement technical measures toward bias, fairness, and explainability to help ensure an ethical future for all.
skills_learnt: AI Governance , Model bias analysis , Ethical AI , Explainable AI
prerequisites: AI fluency , Python data analysis libraries , Machine learning model implementation

title: Advanced Python Techniques
description: In this course, you will learn advanced Python skills and master a myriad of modern subject matter.
skills_learnt: File i/o , Functional programming concepts , Python data structures , Object-oriented Python

title: Building Generative AI Solutions with Vector Databases
description: This lesson covers vector databases, crucial for enhancing AI's long-term memory. Topics include core concepts, retrieval methods, and advanced indexing.
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Database fundamentals , Generative AI Fluency

title: Introduction to Python for AI Programmers
description: Start coding with Python, drawing upon libraries and automation scripts to solve complex problems quickly.
skills_learnt: Python data types , Control flow , Python operators , Python exception handling

title: Supervised Learning
description: In this course, you'll learn about different types of supervised learning and how to use them to solve real-world problems.
skills_learnt: Naive bayes classifiers , Model evaluation , Support vector machines , Decision trees
prerequisites: Basic descriptive statistics , Basic probability , Intermediate Python

title: Data Visualization in Tableau
description: Learn how to select the most appropriate data visualization for an analysis. Learn how to evaluate the effectiveness of a data visualization and build interactive and engaging Tableau dashboards.
skills_learnt: Tableau interactive dashboards , Tableau calculated fields , Tableau map-based visualizations , Data visualization design
prerequisites: Basic spreadsheet use , Basic descriptive statistics

title: Building Generative Adversarial Networks
description: Learn to understand and implement a Deep Convolutional GAN (generative adversarial network) to generate realistic images, with Ian Goodfellow, the inventor of GANs, and Jun-Yan Zhu, the creator of CycleGANs.
skills_learnt: Generative adversarial networks , Model evaluation , Deep learning techniques , Markov games

title: Product Design
description: Once the problem has been defined and a market opportunity has been identified, it is important to create a solution that is desirable by its users. Bring an idea through concept, design, and user validation, as well as creating a spec to hand-off to engineering for development. Use design thinking methodologies to diverge in order to explore ideas, and then ultimately focus in and converge on a single idea. Map out the full concept through the creation of a prototype that can be used to validate that you’re solving a problem for real users.
skills_learnt: Product design sprints , Product prototyping , Project evaluation , Solution sketching

title: Discovering Digital Marketing
description: Take advantage of the high demand for people with digital marketing skills.  Learn the fundamentals of this exciting topic and even explore some real examples of what it looks like in real life.

title: AWS Cloud Fundamentals
description: The cloud has become a key enabler for innovation with beneficial features like high availability, unlimited capacity, and on-demand scalability and elasticity. Learn the fundamentals of cloud computing while being introduced to compute power, security, storage, networking, messaging, and management services in the cloud. While learning the fundamentals, you will explore tools and services offered by Amazon Web Services(AWS) through interactive, hands-on exercises. By the end of the course, you will have deployed your first website to AWS.
skills_learnt: Cloud autoscaling , Vpc , Amazon rds , Cloud load balancing

title: Creating Visualizations with Power BI
description: In this course, students will learn how to carry Power BI beyond mere bar charts and transform their reports into data exploration & storytelling tools that companies can use to better understand their data.
skills_learnt: Power BI Report Customization , Data visualization design , Power BI Report Design , Stakeholder management
prerequisites: Data transformation , Basic descriptive statistics , Database schemas

title: Spark and Data Lakes
description:
In this course, you will learn about the big data ecosystem and how to use Spark to work with
massive datasets. You’ll also learn about how to store big data in a data lake and query it with Spark.
skills_learnt: AWS data lakes , ELT , Big data fluency , Data wrangling
prerequisites: Amazon web services basics , Database fundamentals , Intermediate Python

title: Java Fundamentals
description: In order to be a great Java developer you must first learn the fundamentals of Java. This course introduces the fundamental concepts and practices of Java programming. These include basic Object-oriented Programming (OOP) concepts such as classes, encapsulation and inheritance, as well as core Java concepts such as collections, exceptions and commonly used Java types.
skills_learnt: Java collections , Java data types , Java inheritance , Java syntax

title: Blockchain Fluency
description: In this course, you learn the basics of blockchain, blockchain transactions, data on the blockchain, and the differences between a public blockchain and a private blockchain.

title: Introduction to Version Control
description: Learn how to use version control to save and share your projects with others.

title: Introduction to Deep Learning
description: This course covers foundational deep learning theory and practice. We begin with how to think about deep learning and when it is the right tool to use. The course covers the fundamental algorithms of deep learning, deep learning architecture and goals, and interweaves the theory with implementation in PyTorch.
skills_learnt: Model performance metrics , Perceptron , Neural networks , Deep learning

title: Delivering Value with Agile Planning and Prioritization
description: The Agile approach to planning is an iterative process that focuses on delivering value to the customer.  In this course, you will be introduced to the high level aspects of agile planning, including product vision and roadmaps. You will also learn how to manage requirements at the tactical level, including gathering, writing, and prioritizing requirements using agile techniques from each of the major frameworks. Finally, you will learn different approaches to estimating work and how to build release and iteration plans that help the team continuously deliver value. At the end of the course, you will be equipped with the tools and techniques they need to apply Agile Planning and Prioritization within a team or organization to deliver value more efficiently.
skills_learnt: Sprint planning , Backlog management , User stories , Product release planning

title: Introduction to Data Analytics
description: This course establishes a framework for data analytics as a series of progressive steps starting with the data source and ending with the interpretation of results. We introduce fundamental concepts such as data analytics life cycle, data integrity, and the four types of data analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive). Students who complete this course will be equipped with the skills to identify the data analytics strategy used in a given situation and where they are in the data analytics life cycle.
skills_learnt: Power query , Data analysis process , Power BI Get Data , Power BI Basics

title: Microservices at Scale using AWS and Kubernetes
description: This lesson will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of microservices architecture, containers, and Kubernetes in the context of AWS. You will learn how to build, deploy, and manage containerized applications at scale while utilizing AWS tools and services. By the end of your journey, you will have a strong foundation in containerization, microservices, and Kubernetes DevOps skills, enabling you to tackle real-world challenges in your professional career.
skills_learnt: Kubernetes , Serverless development , Amazon CloudWatch , AWS lambda

title: Advanced Computer Vision and Deep Learning
description: Learn to apply deep learning architectures to computer vision tasks. Discover how to combine CNN and RNN networks to build an automatic image captioning application.
skills_learnt: Recurrent neural networks , Attention mechanisms , Long-short term memory networks , Yolo algorithm
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Neural network basics , Basic probability

title: Preparing and Modeling Data with Power BI
description: This course is a crucial step in Power BI for anyone who needs to mash together multiple data sources, clean them, restructure them, and harmonize them into a single and efficient data model to support reporting. We’ll cover Power BI’s built-in Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) tool, Power Query, learn foundational data modeling principles, cover some introductory DAX (Data Analytics Expressions), and touch on troubleshooting and optimization.
skills_learnt: Data transformation , Dax , Power query , Business reporting fluency

title: Digital Marketing Fluency
description: Becoming a digital marketer is a journey - let us be your guide. In this course, we give you a framework to help you organize and plan your approach.

title: Advanced Data Wrangling
description: Data wrangling is a set of processes for turning raw and messy data into a clean format to answer interesting questions from the data. In this course, you will learn the three phases of data wrangling: gathering, assessing, and cleaning data.
skills_learnt: Data cleaning , Data storage , Data Tidiness Assessment , Data gathering
prerequisites: Basic Python , Basic descriptive statistics , Pandas

title: Server Deployment and Containerization
description:
Develop an understanding of containerized environments, use Docker to share and store containers, and deploy a Docker
container to AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service using the CI/CD pipeline.
skills_learnt: Docker , Kubernetes , Containerization fluency , Continuous deployment
prerequisites: Identity and access management fundamentals , Object-relational mapping , Command line interface basics

title: Build CI/CD Pipelines, Monitoring, and Logging
description: In this course, you will learn how to stretch for Continuous Delivery as your “true north” while you build CI/CD systems that automate the “stuff” between developers and the cloud. You’ll gain essential knowledge and put it into practice as you learn about Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment. You’ll combine your existing knowledge of Cloud Formation and AWS with new tools like GitHub Actions.
skills_learnt: Logging , Continuous integration , Continuous deployment , Github actions

title: Introduction to Web Development
description: Get acquainted with how the web works! Learn about your browser, the internet, and a filetype called HTML. HTML stands for "Hypertext Markup Language." HTML is the language used to create webpages. Learn the basics of HTML to create a simple web page!
skills_learnt: CSS , HTML , Front-end development basics , Code debugging

title: Digital Arts and AI Tools Fluency
description:
Unleash your creativity with our introductory course on Digital Arts and AI Tools. This course acts as a gateway to the fascinating world of digital art, combining digital art principles with cutting-edge AI technologies. After taking this course, you will be familiar with the fundamental digital art skills and a variety of AI tools that are rapidly revolutionizing the art landscape.

You will start by learning the basics of digital arts, including elements and principles of design, the creative process, and how to work with images using free online software. After that, you will learn how to use DALL-E, ArtBreeder, and Midjourney to create digital artwork. You will also learn how to write effective prompts for AI-based text-to-image tools.

title: Cybersecurity Foundations
description: Security is embedded in all we do online and is a critical job skill and career field. This foundations course explains security fundamentals including core principles, critical security controls, and cybersecurity best practices. Students will also evaluate specific security techniques used to administer a system that meets industry standards and core controls, assess high-level risks, vulnerabilities, and attack vectors of a sample system, and explain ways to establish and maintain the security of different types of computer systems.
skills_learnt: Cybersecurity fluency , Vulnerability management , Identity and access management fundamentals , Threat intelligence
prerequisites: Operating system fundamentals , Cybersecurity fluency , Computer networking basics

title: Zero Trust Security
description: This course introduces the zero trust security model, a dynamic approach to addressing the continual evolution of cybersecurity threats for organizations that demand flexibility and scalability in modern work environments. Traditional security models that rely on strong outer defenses are no longer viable strategies to protect a company’s valuable assets. Students who complete this course will be able to critically examine corporate security practices against the philosophy of “Never Trust, Always Verify”, and will be empowered to advocate for Zero Trust Architecture initiatives.
skills_learnt: Zero Trust Algorithms , Zero Trust Deployment Strategy , Zero trust security model , Zero Trust Maturity Model
prerequisites: Cybersecurity fluency , Application architecture , Computer networking basics

title: RPA Fluency
description: In this course, we will learn what Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is, and the benefits of implementing RPA in your work. We will also introduce the RPA solution landscape and what it takes to successfully implement RPA solutions.

title: Data Privacy
description: Data Privacy, the protection of personal information, is a world-wide requirement for any organization that may collect, store, transmit or otherwise use sensitive information about people. With the rise of the data economy, companies find enormous value in collecting, sharing and using personal data, but are they doing it safely and within required guidelines? This class provides learners with an understanding of core data privacy fundamentals so that they can appropriately manage sensitive, private data and risks associated with it.
skills_learnt: Data privacy regulations , Data privacy classification , Nist cybersecurity framework , Data privacy fundamentals

title: Introduction to Programming with Python II
description: Continue to advance your skills as a beginning programmer! Python is one of the most versatile and widely used programming languages. In this second-level course, you will build on your understanding of fundamental Python and learn some more advanced skills, including how to work with files on your computer's disk and how to use Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) to create classes, objects, and methods.
skills_learnt: Object-oriented Python , Python data structures , Text processing in Python , Python classes

title: Introduction to Data Science
description: Learn the data science process, including how to build effective data visualizations, and how to communicate with various stakeholders.
skills_learnt: Blog posts , Predictive analytics , Data storytelling , AI algorithms in Python

title: Foundations of Agile and Agile Frameworks
description: In this course, you will be introduced to The Agile Mindset and how it sets the tone for "Being" Agile versus just "Doing" Agile. You will learn to leverage The Agile Manifesto as the foundation for all Agile Frameworks, as well as identify the practical differences between Agile and Waterfall approaches. You will then take a deep dive into Agile Teams and Governance and apply best practices of both in order to deliver immense business value. By the end of this course, you will master characteristics of three of the more popular Agile Frameworks being utilized across all industries, which are Scrum, Kanban and XP, as well as apply The Agile Manifesto to deliver practical value in Agile teams and organizations.
skills_learnt: Building agile teams , Agile fluency , Kanban , Agile governance

title: Computer Vision and Generative AI
description: Learn how computers process and understand image data, then harness the power of the latest Generative AI models to create new images.
skills_learnt: Image pre-processing , Transfer learning , Word embeddings , Ethical AI
prerequisites: Transformer neural networks , Hugging Face , Deep learning

title: Multi-Cloud Computing
description: This course introduces learners to multi-cloud architectures and how to design and implement these architectures effectively. In this course, learners will learn how to define, design and deploy multi-cloud architectures. They’ll begin by learning the key components to understand and design a proper multi-cloud application. They will also learn the pros and cons of multi-cloud and important considerations when designing for them. Lastly, they will create a multi-cloud design and then deploy it to multiple providers.
skills_learnt: Terraform , Cloud migration strategy , Cloud cost evaluation , Cloud architecture proficiency
prerequisites: Cloud computing fluency , Azure CLI , Basic Terraform

title: Building Generative AI Solutions
description: The Generative AI Solutions course offers a deep dive into AI development and design, focusing on practical skills and theoretical knowledge. It covers semantic search, teaching how AI interprets and responds to human language, and vector databases for managing complex AI data structures. The course also explores LangChain for building language models and practical applications of AI in various fields. This program equips learners with the skills to create advanced, user-friendly AI systems.
skills_learnt: Vectors , Retrieval-Augmented Generation , OpenAI API , LangChain
prerequisites: Database fundamentals , Intermediate Python , Generative AI Fluency

title: Building a Reproducible Model Workflow
description: This course empowers the students to be more efficient, effective, and productive in modern, real-world ML projects by adopting best practices around reproducible workflows. In particular, it teaches the fundamentals of MLops and how to: a) create a clean, organized, reproducible, end-to-end machine learning pipeline from scratch using MLflow b) clean and validate the data using pytest c) track experiments, code, and results using GitHub and Weights & Biases d) select the best-performing model for production and e) deploy a model using MLflow. Along the way, it also touches on other technologies like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, and Great Expectations and how they relate to the content of the class.
skills_learnt: Machine learning configuration management , Exploratory data analysis , Weights & biases , Data cleaning

title: Embedded Systems Fundamentals
description: This Nanodegree provides an overview of embedded systems. You will cover key components like microcontrollers and microprocessors. You'll explore resources, peripheral devices, and the nuances of analog and digital signals before taking an in-depth look at digital signal processing. Here, you'll delve into clocking, logic circuits, gate combinations, and multiplexers, enabling you to construct advanced logical circuits based on truth tables. Lastly, you will learn how to use breadboards for testing and prototyping and understand the intricacies of synchronous and asynchronous processing in embedded systems. In the final project, you will design and implement a microprocessor-based, digital device-control interface.
skills_learnt: Digital signal processing proficiency , Logic Gates , Logic Circuits , Digital signal processing
prerequisites: Embedded Systems and Robotics Fluency , Basic Python

title: Preparing and Modeling Data with Power BI Fluency
description: This course is a crucial step in Power BI for anyone who needs to mash together multiple data sources, clean them, restructure them, and harmonize them into a single and efficient data model to support reporting.

title: Backend Development with Node.js
description: This course introduces the fundamental tools needed to build a basic API in a way that is both scalable, and maintainable.  You will work with Node.js and its core modules, write TypeScript for developer error reduction, test with Jasmine to introduce unit testing in a Test-Driven Development environment, and use Express as a framework for building APIs.
skills_learnt: NodeJS , API testing , Express web framework , Asynchronous JavaScript

title: Unsupervised Learning
description: In this course, you'll learn how to apply unsupervised learning to solve real-world problems.
skills_learnt: Gaussian mixture models , Single linkage clustering , K-means clustering , Dimensionality reduction
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Basic descriptive statistics , Basic probability

title: Convolutional Neural Networks
description: This course introduces Convolutional Neural Networks, the most widely used type of neural networks specialized in image processing. You will learn the main characteristics of CNNs that make them so useful for image processing, their inner workings, and how to build them from scratch to complete image classification tasks. You will learn what are the most successful CNN architectures, and what are their main characteristics. You will apply these architectures to custom datasets using transfer learning. You will also learn about autoencoders, a very important architecture at the basis of many modern CNNs, and how to use them for anomaly detection as well as image denoising. Finally, you will learn how to use CNNs for object detection and semantic segmentation.
skills_learnt: Image pre-processing , Image segmentation , Neural network initialization , Bounding boxes
prerequisites: Deep learning fluency , Neural network basics , Intermediate Python

title: Data Stewardship Fluency
description: This course will give you an introduction to data stewardship. You will be introduced to who data stewards are, the importance of data stewards, and the data management and governance responsibility of a data steward.

title: Embedded Systems and Robotics Fluency
description: This course will teach you the basics behind embedded systems, including electrical circuits, digital logic, and computer architecture. You will then learn how these pieces combine to create embedded systems, robotics, and autonomous systems.

title: Social Media Marketing
description: Social Media is a powerful channel for marketers.  In this course, you learn more about the main social media platforms, how to manage your social media presence, leveraging organic and paid to advertise, and creating effective content for each platform.
skills_learnt: Social media advertising , Content calendars , Social media marketing platforms , Social media content

title: Dashboard Design
description: In this course, you’ll learn the process of designing and creating dashboards within an enterprise environment. You’ll learn to discover user needs, identify key metrics, and tailor your dashboard to a particular audience. You’ll learn to use design elements to maximize the effectiveness of the dashboard and how to iterate based on user feedback.
skills_learnt: Data visualization design , Usability testing , Wireframes , Feedback loops

title: Introduction to Data Analysis with Pandas and NumPy
description: Learn the data analysis process of questioning, wrangling, exploring, analyzing, and communicating data. You will work with data in Python using libraries like NumPy and pandas.
skills_learnt: Pandas , Exploratory data analysis , Basic data visualizations , Jupyter notebooks

title: Data lakes and Lakehouses with Spark and Azure Databricks
description: Learn about the big data ecosystem and how to use Spark to work with massive datasets. Learners will also store big data in a data lake and develop Lakehouse architecture on the Azure Databricks platform.
skills_learnt: Big data fluency , Databricks , Data lakes , Apache Spark

title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: In this course, you'll start learning what machine learning is by being introduced to the high level concepts through AWS SageMaker. You'll begin by using SageMaker Studio to perform exploratory data analysis. Know how and when to apply the basic concepts of machine learning to real world scenarios. Create machine learning workflows, starting with data cleaning and feature engineering, to evaluation and hyperparameter tuning. Finally, you'll build new ML workflows with highly sophisticated models such as XGBoost and AutoGluon.
skills_learnt: Feature engineering , Machine learning fluency , AI business context , Machine learning use cases

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: In this course, you'll learn about the foundations of AI. You'll configure your programming environment to work on AI problems with Python.   At the end of the course you'll build a Sudoku solver and solve constraint satisfaction problems.
skills_learnt: Constraint propagation , Constraint satisfaction problems , Search algorithms , Backtracking search
prerequisites: Object-oriented programming basics , Command line interface basics , Basic algorithms

title: Azure Applications
description: In this course, you will learn the basics of deploying an application to Azure. Understand the benefits and costs of cloud deployments, different types of service models, and how to navigate the Microsoft Azure platform. Distinguish two types of compute services in Azure, virtual machines and app services, when to use each, and how to deploy applications onto the related service. Connect two useful types of cloud storage to a cloud application: Azure SQL databases and blob containers. Differentiate between the different security options available in Azure, and how to implement Microsoft’s OAuth 2.0 capabilities with Azure Active Directory, along with useful monitoring and logging tools in the cloud.
skills_learnt: Cloud security in Azure , SQL databases in Azure , Azure resource groups , Azure blob storage

title: Introduction to Natural Language Processing
description: This section provides an overview of the program and introduces the fundamentals of Natural Language Processing through symbolic manipulation, including text cleaning, normalization, and tokenization. You'll then build a part of speech tagger using hidden Markov models.
prerequisites: Neural network basics , Object-oriented programming basics , Deep learning framework proficiency

title: Data Architecture Foundations
description: In this course, you will cover the foundations of data architecture.
skills_learnt: Erds , Data definition language , Data manipulation language , Data storage

title: Object Tracking and Localization
description: Learn how to locate an object and track it over time. These techniques are used in a variety of moving systems, such as self-driving car navigation and drone flight.
skills_learnt: Object tracking , Slam , Object localization , Feature matching
prerequisites: Basic probability , Object-oriented Python , Basic arithmetic

title: React Native
description: Explore the possibilities of React Native for building hybrid phone apps; learn how to create push notifications, display customer information, and create interactive view for your user!
skills_learnt: React native basics , Mobile app styling , React native os APIs , Css-in-js

title: Advanced Java Programming Techniques
description: The best Java programs combine excellent software designs with modern language features. This course will teach you some lesser known features of Java, such as functional programming, I/O, serialization, and reflection. Strengthen your software design intuition by exploring the design ideas that underpin understandable, extensible and scalable software systems. Learn the basic concepts and techniques of concurrent programming in Java, so your programs can take advantage of modern, multi-core hardware.
skills_learnt: Java reflection , Design pattern fundamentals , Java stream API , Dependency injection
prerequisites: Design pattern fundamentals , Basic Java , Concurrent computing

title: Data Ingestion with Kafka and Kafka Streaming
description: Learn to use REST Proxy, Kafka Connect, KSQL, and Faust Python Stream Processing and use it to stream public transit statuses using Kafka and Kafka ecosystem to build a stream processing application that shows the status of trains in real-time.
skills_learnt: Faust , Confluent Kafka Python client , Kafka rest proxy , KSQL

title: Introduction to Airflow
description: Learn about Apache Airflow DAGs and how to use them to automate basic data pipelines.

title: Data Modeling
description: Learn to create relational and NoSQL data models to fit the diverse needs of data consumers. Use ETL to build databases in PostgreSQL and Apache Cassandra.
skills_learnt: Database fundamentals , Cassandradb , PostgreSQL , Database normalization

title: Experimental Design and Recommendations
description: Learn to design experiments and analyze A/B test results. Explore approaches for building recommendation systems.
skills_learnt: Interpreting test results , Smart experiments , Experiment control , Recommendation engine fluency
prerequisites: Basic statistical modeling , Data wrangling , Python for data science

title: Java Application Deployment
description: This course introduces Java ecosystem topics that are necessary to develop production-ready applications. It starts by covering the construction and makeup of Java program artifacts. You will learn how Java program code is compiled, packaged and executed. Next, you’ll learn how to use Maven to automate and customize the build process, as well as manage external project dependencies. This course also covers the topic of Modules, introduced in Java 9. In addition to build topics, this course will also teach you to use the tools of JUnit 5 to write unit tests and evaluate code coverage. To expand our testing capabilities for complex applications, the Mockito library and test doubles will be covered as well.
skills_learnt: Maven , Unit testing , Java modules , JRE

title: Predictive Data Analysis
description: This course introduces students to a selection of powerful tools in Power BI Desktop that can be used for predictive analysis. Concepts such as classification, regression, and forecasting are discussed in detail, and various techniques are explored with different data sets, allowing students to practice predictive data analysis with a hands-on approach. The content covered in this course can help an enterprise to understand future risk, analyze different markets or make other decisions critical to an organization.
skills_learnt: Cluster models , Time-series analysis , Automated machine learning , Power BI Data Pipeline
prerequisites: Data transformation , Basic descriptive statistics , Data visualization

title: Product Development
description: This course introduces Product Development, with a focus on the role a Product Manager plays and key activities that occur during development, including the lifecycle of a code change, creating test plans, getting early feedback, effectively prioritizing issues, and running a go/no go launch meeting.
skills_learnt: Project management frameworks , Prioritization , Cross-functional collaboration , Functional testing
prerequisites: Product development cycle , Product management basics , Professional presentations

title: React Fundamentals
description: In this course, you'll learn fundamental React concepts and create interactive React components for web applications using JSX to render UI, manage state, and handle lifecycle events.
skills_learnt: React component state , React router , React design patterns , React hooks

title: Automate Data Pipelines
description: In this course, you'll build pipelines leveraging Airflow DAGs to organize your tasks along with AWS resources such as S3 and Redshift.
skills_learnt: Apache Airflow , Data pipeline dags , Data pipeline partitioning , Amazon s3
prerequisites: Data modeling basics , Intermediate Python , Database fundamentals

title: Introduction to Neural Networks with PyTorch
description: Learn the fundamentals of neural networks with Python and PyTorch, and then use your new skills to create your own image classifier—an application that will first train a deep learning model on a dataset of images and then use the trained model to classify new images.
skills_learnt: Gradient descent , AI algorithms in Python , Training neural networks , NumPy
prerequisites: Basic descriptive statistics , Python for data science , Basic probability

title: Digital Arts Foundations
description: This Nanodegree explores digital art and graphic design through software like Canva, focusing on 2D shapes, layout, and Mondrian-inspired compositions. It covers color theory, RGB, and Hex codes, using Adobe Color for custom themes. We'll examine the printing press's impact, typography, and typeface selection. We will also delve into texture, space, and spatial depth in art, learn about balance and scale in composition, and explore symmetry and asymmetry. Furthermore, we'll learn about contrast and pattern, movement, rhythm, emphasis, and visual hierarchy in design. We will also learn about unity, including Gestalt principles and design brief analysis. In the final project, you will design a vector-based poster for your social media website, showcasing your graphic design skills.
skills_learnt: Visual design principles , Canva , Visual Design Elements

title: Big Data Systems
description: There are 2 main roles in the Big Data industry: Big Data Engineer and Big Data Architect. We will focus on the Architect role. We will look at the characteristics of Big Data, its business value, and how companies are using Big Data today. We study the most popular storage and processing frameworks.....aka...Big Data ecosystem components. We will dive deep into NoSQL,  how it differs from traditional relational databases, how to model, and what the tool interface looks like.
