This program is very useful. It is a great introduction to machine learning. What I really liked about the project is that you gain a lot of practical skills. You learn how to structure a real life project.
The program is going well, and it matched expectations by programming samples and exercises. Providing workbench for practice
its is satisfying so far
i liked it one of the best thing about this course is one can start getting the flavor of machine learning and apply to real problem sets

Very good..so far yes

It is very good. In my opinion, it can get much better if it goes into the details of the concept and the dive into the math a little more. A friend of mine disagrees with me :)

The program is really good. I am having fun on working the exercises and it was particularly fun to work on the first project. The lectures are good, with good length and the concepts are all well worked. It is matching my needs, specially in getting acquaitance with how to build the models, the codes etc. The only thing that, until now, the program is not matching is to work better in the math and the theory behind each model. There are little, if any, in this topic.

I am feeling pretty good about it. The program requires me to know the classes and methods in scikit learn to a decent level. Though I think the some of the questions in the CharityML project were unecessary.

As a a first course in machine learning it's pretty good. Some videos contain(unaddressed) mathematical simplifications for simpler cases(without it being mentioned). Being from an engineering background I feel course lacks mathematical rigor(expected as it's a beginner course) and accuracy(some videos just don't pay attention to the simplest of details for multi-dimensional cases, which could have been improved as mentors don't answer well sometimes which is frustrating) . Assignments could have been better involving more of what has been learnt.
It was okay not super challenging and thank you for the reviews

This nanodegree is very thorough. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to learn machine learning and get hands on experience. The projects have been made with clear objectives and focus. It gives the student a lot of opportunity to experiment and use their intuition to come up with final solution. Once completed, you will have the confidence to go out and tackle any data based problem.
Yes It matched my needs and expectations.
Amazing nanodegree program. The way the course outline is designed you don't see it even in well known universities. All is more than my expectations.

I would like to have more flexible assignments so that I don't just follow the guidelines, but figure out the approach (like data cleaning, model selection, etc.) by myself
Project was nice..I wish this course had more duration.
Excellent feedback! Very helpful for learning beyond the scope of the project.

So far so good - I¬¥m just a bit behind and it¬¥s hard to find time when you have a full time job as well! I found the project really good as hands-on practice. The material is also well explained in the lessons so I¬¥m happy so far

I understand that number of epochs, batch size, and network structure were totally up to me, and it was good in some ways to leave the implementation entirely up to me. However, I was worried that I over did it in some parts: too many epochs, too large a batch size, too many convolutional layers, etc. It would be helpful to include some upper bound limits or suggestions I think, like 'try not to exceed 30 epochs, but some students have had great success with only 3!'

title: A/B Testing
description: This course will cover the design and analysis of A/B tests, which are online experiments used throughout tech industry by companies like Google, Amazon, and Netflix.

title: Introduction to Operating Systems
description: Not Available

title: C++ For Programmers
description: C++ for Programmers is designed for students who are familiar with a programming language and wish to learn C++.

title: Intro to Relational Databases
description: Relational databases are a powerful tool used throughout the industry. Learn the basics of SQL and how to connect your Python code to a relational database.

title: Intro to iOS App Development with Swift
description: Take the first step in becoming an iOS Developer by learning about Swift and writing your first app.

title: Interactive 3D Graphics
description: This course will teach you the principles of 3D computer graphics: meshes, transforms, lighting, animation, and making interactive 3D applications run in a browser.

title: Scalable Microservices with Kubernetes
description: This course is designed to teach you about managing microservices, using Kubernetes. This course is built in partnership with experts such as Google’s Kelsey Hightower.

title: Applied Cryptography
description: Cryptography is present in everyday life, from paying with a credit card to using the telephone.  Learn all about making and breaking puzzles in computing.

title: Data Wrangling with MongoDB
description: Data Scientists spend most of their time cleaning data. In this course, you will learn to convert and manipulate messy data to extract what you need.

title: Intro to Physics
description: Go to the places where big physics discoveries were made in the past and make them yourself. You’ll visit Italy, the Netherlands, and the UK as you learn basic physics.

title: Statistics
description: We live in a time of unprecedented access to information. You'll learn how to use statistics to interpret that information and make decisions.

title: Intro to Psychology
description: Go on a journey through psychological concepts and principles to enable you to gain a more in-depth understanding of human thought and behavior.

title: Intro to Deep Learning with PyTorch
description: Learn the basics of deep learning, and build your own deep neural networks using PyTorch, an open source machine learning library used for applications such as NLP and Computer Vision.

title: Software Development Process
description: Learn best practices for using an Agile framework to build better products faster and more efficiently.
skills_learnt: Agile metrics , Sprint planning , Continuous improvement , Agile communication

title: Full Stack Foundations
description: Learn the fundamentals of back-end web development by creating your own web application from the ground up using the iterative development process.

title: Designing RESTful APIs
description: Build and secure a web server with a RESTful Developer-Friendly API that developers will love to use.

title: Reinforcement Learning
description: The Deep Reinforcement Learning Nanodegree has four courses: Introduction to Deep Reinforcement Learning, Value-Based Methods, Policy-Based Methods, and Multi-Agent RL. Students learn to implement classical solution methods, define Markov decision processes, policies, and value functions, and derive Bellman equations. They learn dynamic programming, Monte Carlo methods, temporal-difference methods, deep RL, and apply these techniques to solve real-world problems. They learn to train agents to navigate virtual worlds, generate optimal financial trading strategies, and apply RL to multiple interacting agents.
skills_learnt: Value-based reinforcement learning , Stochastic policy gradients , Reinforce algorithm , Exploration-exploitation dilemma
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Deep learning framework proficiency , Neural network basics

reviews.content: It's little bit difficult but interesting.
Great, Awesome, Amazing.
Very Well
Very organized and professional educational content as usual!
Perfect!
Very interesting and informative. I think the program is well designed and structured.
The program is good, although becoming outdated with time. The programming environment with PyTorch is outdated by 3-4 years now, and it'd be nice to update it.

The program is going really well, it has exceeded my expectations! I¬¥ve learned a lot so far and I think this course will help me tackle real world problems in my organization.   Thanks again for your support!

Only problem I have is that some of the code implementations provided/used in this course uses old python packages and these codes might need to be updated
Overall the program is cool, I learnt a lot from this first project, but I got difficulty in setting up for local operation which is a negative point.

Looking good! It's quite a good introduction to DRL.

I love 5e topic, and the program is certainly serving as my motivation to learn, learn, learn about DRL. The problem is that the content simply isn‚Äôt rich enough. There should realistically be 3x the amount of videos as there are now. Look at Andrew Nag‚Äôs Intro to Deep Learning course. Way more videos and explains everything in a real lecture fashion. While learning from books and other outside sources is great, the fact that I spend 5x as long in the outside sources learning as I get in the content I‚Äôm paying for is indicative that there is simply not enough information here. Each complex topic simply cannot be boiled down to one 3-min video.

Even though is quite tough, especially for someone coming from a different field than computer science, the course is very well structured and the contents are very well explained by the teacher, in addition  all material provided (research papers, codes, descriptions and guides) are very helpful. The Deep Q-networks needs improvements on the videos, they are so superficial and I think that is one of the more important topics on this course.

Long Ago i plan to do this nanodegree as I am very interested in the topic . Finally i got some time to do it and it is fully meeting my expectations . Content , examples and specially the projects are very good in my opinion
Very interesting program. The information is really great and it takes you step by step. Is amazing how much i have learned on these few months.

The provided python code is very optimized and not easy readable. I think for teaching purpose it would make more sense to write more lines of code which are better readable instead of using the full python features to get everything in one line.
Everything is fine but quite challenging.
Very interesting course, labs could have been more challenging though :)
Great review!
Content is good, but projects aren't up to date.

The program contents have been great  so far. The only downside I saw was in the design of the first project. Including me, there have been many complaints about the difficulties in setting up the environments. I think Udacity should provide better instructions, in order to save each student hours of trial-and-errors.
Feel we can add more examples or exercises / use cases along the way.

The videos are very clear and focused, although I would find it better if they were longer than a few minutes. 10-20 minutes seem better for getting in depth with the more advanced topics, and to avoid repetitions.
It's going good!
The course is great, it explains well difficult concepts.

it's excellent. but i would have also preferred to have implementation of many state of the art DeepRL algorithms within Udacity's repo(A3C/A2C, Rainbow DQN, etc...). Although there are many great public repository implementations. so i won't complain.

I'm learning what I need to start my personal projects, and I couldn't do it in another site, so that's amazing. In the first part of the course, I missed some in-depth lessons for Double DQN, Prioritized Experience replay and Dueling DQN, in fact I had to search a lot on the Internets. I hope to keep learning and finish the Nanodegree with solid bases to automatize the complex task I had in mind.
So far, so good. Very impressed with the content and delivery.

It really surpassed my expectations so far! I'm impressed by how resourceful the contents are. Especially, the extracurricular content illustrating Neural Networks. I reached the halfway point of the course. I hope you continue your great work.
So far it's been very interesting.

Compared o the nanodegree in DL, the project is harder this time. But it is a nice opportunity to revisit the material again and again when I got stuck with what to write in the report.  Still, I have little time to read the text book in RL...

I remember being unable to understand why certain quiz answer were correct even after seeing the modal window with the result.  Overall it's really fun to learn the interesting matter.
So far so good. Challenging and insightful.
Good learning with hands on projects.
Some more topics related to practical applications of RL can be added in the course.
This program has a way more advanced curriculum, I would recommend it to anyone who wish to take it. you won't regret your time taking this nanodegreee.
This program is doing big and fast lessons. In my opinion it could be a bit more verbose and repetitive.
It's going great so far. I really appreciate the quality standards for the projects/assignments.

The program is great! It is very challenging for me because I didn't have as much background in deep learning or reinforcement learning before starting. I thought the lecture material did a great job covering the key concepts and intuition, the extra material borrowed from other courses for review was key for me when it came to deep neural networks and specifically CNNs and using pytorch, and then the Sutton and Barto book added additional context and depth to the material.   The first project took me a long time because I purposefully tried to implement it without being too close to the reference implementations in exercises leading up to it thinking it would help me really drill in the material, and I think it was good for me, but to finish  the nanodegree on time I may stick closer to recommended approaches in future assignments.
good, yes it has

The difficulty and amount of the work of the project were just right. Comments by reviewers were high quality and really great.  One pain point of the project was setting up the project environment. The project relied on the specific Python version (3.6) and it didn't work with the latest python environment such as Python 3.9, 3.8. In order to make it work, I needed several attempt to set up different version of Python in the same machine with virtulenv, pyenv and etc. Also, since the project used the custom version of ML Agent, installing it and make it work was another big pain which took more than a week.
The program is going great so far! The first project was very fun and educational, and I am excited to plow forward!

Love the animations, they really help!  But I would have liked something a little heavier on the theoretical side as well. Otherwise, a lot of the improvements just seem like tricks that happened to work. For example, in PPO, how do we know the tricks actually reduce noise? What is noise?

I've learned that there are so many ways to solve a problem... but could you provide various videos with alternative approaches...the hints are great...but something that would show how you actively try to solve something and how small changes impact the whole code might help. (you've did it in one video which was really great)  I've had to submit my project 7 times - some of your reviewers were of great help and gave amazing feedback with visuals...thank you so much and you kept me going...but others were very brief which was frustrating and I almost wanted to quit and look for an alternative platform.

I have a feedback on my project review: The first time I submit my project - reviewer returned my submission saying it was copied from some code on git. It was very offensive and annoying to see that. I have followed all the instructions in the workspace and worked hard on the project and I don't even have a git account.   I would appreciate if reviewers can spend some time and effort in reviewing the work before making such statements.
amazing; boosted my interest in software engineering and AI

the program itself and the material is perfect, I feel like it could benefit to have more help from mentors though

The program is going great!  One of the better courses I've taken!

I found the instructions for the project to be verbose and meandering.  You were mixing instruction in with the specifications; I found that very confusing and made it hard for me to follow.  Next the project was comprised of modules I was to complete and modules that were provided as part of the lesson.  During the process of completing my modules, I ran into several bugs in the provided modules.  I found this very irritating, but a friend pointed out that perhaps the bugs in the provided modules were part of the process.  I would suggest that if that was indeed the intention, that you indicate that for others so they can be prepared.  Next, write a concise and clear specification and have the teaching occur someplace else.  However by this time in the course, we should be able to complete this assignment without the additional teaching, reminders and hints.

I enjoy this program!  It is very well structured, everything is coherent and I feel I am building something big.  If you like comparisons, it is like a good martial arts training, where every day you do some theory and some sparring.  One without the other makes no sense and becomes an illusion of something.   The course takes a huge amount of the free time. I am wondering how others do.
Great Introduction to AI Programming

So far so good.  I did a bit of python programming many years ago at university and at my prior job. So I knew about half of content given in this course back than butI had forgotten all of it. The course is exactly at the right level to recall and build on it.

title: Software Architecture & Design
description: Learn best practices for using an Agile framework to build better products faster and more efficiently.
skills_learnt: Agile metrics , Sprint planning , Continuous improvement , Agile communication

reviews.content: Very happy with the program so far. Looking forward to new challenges.
The program is doing great. It matches my expectation very well.

So far so good. The first course was packed of new information, I found if very valuable. I personally don't like doing PowerPoint presentations ( I am SW engineer, I like code, not words :-D ) , but, eventually, I managed to make it through.

I am happy with the program and the first part of it was both interesting and informative. The project was beautiful and complex and a true challenge. I would have loved to read the 'solution' of it or, at least, have a more detailed output in my project review. I would like to know if I got the right (well, there is no right clearly) PO, the right scrum master etc.  Looking forward to the next project!
It was a very good project for me to implement the stuff that I have learned.
Nine nice
Really great!
The program is Great! I have learned so far a lot of new things and the program is very interesting and practice Oriented.

The program is nicely made and it made mostly fun. But sometimes the videos do not display the information in the tasks. Unfortunately, I forgot to write it down and can't provide feedback where this was.
The program is rich and an ideal match of my expectations
It was great learning. I had fun making the first project
Fantastic course i am really enjoying it. I would recommend that the deck that the instructor uses is made available for download to the students.
All good so far
It's going well so far!
This is a great course. I have learnt agile and have an overview idea which is quite beneficial for my work.
Enjoying it, it's informative and has definitely helped my development in Product and Agile.
Going great

Everything is going well, project was quite tricky, but was very nice to get feedback and pass it! I feel that my knowledge is growing incrementally. It was nice to get feedback and additional resources to read, would be great to have these links in learning material.
it is very informative but a bit too much information to memorize
I learned a lot, and actually, I recommended it to my colleagues who started doing it.
This program met all my expectations.
It's very simple to understand and very well explained.

This program gives me hope. On all my works as a programmer for more than 10 years I have saw weak management, bad processes and completely no agreements respect by POs. At some point I completely lost hope to Agile and opportunity to good processes. After I left my job for my own business I took this program to learn just theory and planed to use it in my own interpretation. But I got so much more. Now I know than I'm not the only one who see it this way. And it's so pleasure to listen right words from people who know what Agile really is. Thank you for that!
The program is Great . I feel that I'm learning lots of new things about agile really exited
actually, this is the best Nono Agile program in the world
Fully matched my expectation
great
So far the program is reaching my expectation. I'm able to learn and practice with a real scenarios which is very good to clear and deep understand of what I'm learning in the videos.
Awesome
I am enjoying the program so far - the layout and thought that has gone in to the lessons is vastly superior to any other online course I have taken.

Yes, it's going good.  I would love to have more course materials as a take away, maybe after completion, like blank burn up or burn down charts that I could use at work, or maybe image assets that visualize Agile principles.  WOuld be a good reward for course completion, to take with me AND promote udacity?  LIke a high res pdf or jpg of 12 agile principles and 4 core values?  just an idea.
Yes. I really love the program. I think extra resources for me to read will be better.
Excellent Intro to Agile
Thanks All It is so powerful and informative program
It's demanding but I gained a lot of practical knowledge.
The nanoprogramm really gives a good insight to the agile development subject. from fundamentals to different examples. I really enjoy learning with udacity.
yes, it's matched my expectations
it's going great
It is going very well, yes it meets my needs and expectations.
Right on track - very experienced crew behind the course. Many thanks, Philippe
I am using Udacity since 2013, I have learned Python here, and this Agile PM nanodegree has the same high quality of online education that I received here through the years.
I appreciate the responsiveness of the mentors and their support
The best things about the Udacity's nanodegree, are the projects and reviews. I recommend it 100%
Oustanding experience!
Good Teacher, Case study
Awesome!
Its going well. I would like to have seen greater emphasis on the product development lifecycle, as well as examples of each artefact.
In the upcoming projects, I need more details about the project.   Thank you.
Going great!
It has matched my expectations and I've learnt a lot from this program. However, I really think, Udacity should incorporate the use of a tool like Atlassian's Jira.
It has far exceeded my expectations. The content is engaging and the mentor ship is wonderful!
good structured, nice trainings and very quick and helpful feedback on the submissions
Going great. The projects are really hands on and aligned with what is actually needed in real Agile settings.
So far I really like the program and can recommend it.
It was informative. The content was very logical.
Wow! Intensive and content-rich! Glad I joined this nanodegree
I think the program is going great. I really have hope and deep in my knowledge and Agile practices and I can‚Äôt wait to apply this to my career.
The program is OK. Maybe I expected more when I bought it...
I am very happy. Thank my teacher. They give very good feedback. :)

The program is awesome. I really like it. It feels so good to learn everything about agile software development on this level. It's definitely it's money worth. The review on my first project was super and I learned a lot from it. Never had a comparable instructive experience in online learning.
very nice

I love to learn how to apply knowledge and what could be important working on business case and presenting finding to prospective client. It makes this program unique.  A bit weird presented methodology, but I understand is like it presented within IT industry. Anyway it's a great experience so far. Will see how it goes with the next proejct.
loooooove it
This program has given a good insight on how Agile is evaluated and implemented. All the areas related to agile are explained well.
Introduction to Agile methodologies and to its most common frameworks in a simple, easy and intuitive way
It is a comprehensive program and totally covers A-Z topics of Agile software development.
Great content. Very well structured and directly applicable to my job.
very good mixture of input and practice to integrate subject matter! Project-Reviews come quickly (in some parts they seem to be written quite hurriedly)

I think the information is great. The first project may be a bit much with 2 presentations. Also, I had a bit of trouble with the section about training/coaching. It would probably be good to have a section in the course that explains or gives some examples of this since we are students learning this and not actual coaches with experience. Overall though, happy with the course so far.
expensive but it has matched some needs and expectations. if i find a new job i will be happier with the program :)
wonderful
Going great. Love that it is self-paced.

Excellent program for an Agile beginner like me. The content is outstanding, engaging and thorough. I found everything I learned to be very applicable both inside and outside software development and data science. The only thing I did not like were the projects, I think they were mostly a chore, but I highly recommend the  Nanodegree!!
I am really happy and satisfied with first lesson and the project Thank you for the effort you done to make this program the way it is

To be honest, I was not sure at first because of the troubles I have had learning new things. Plus not having anything to reference what I'm learning to, made it hard up until the first project and working on that and finding all the information and putting it to use made things come in more clear then before. The second part after the 1st project seems to be easier to understand and see how everything that I learned before ties in with Agile. I love Udacity and the learning experience that I have had since I have started. Even been considering taking another course after this one.

title: Data Visualization and D3.js
description: Learn the fundamentals of data visualization and apply design and narrative concepts to create your own visualization.

title: Object Oriented Programming in Java
description: In this course you will learn all about Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and how to create an entire Java project using objects and classes.

title: Firebase in a Weekend (Android)
description: This course will teach you when and why to choose Firebase as a backend for your Android application.

title: JavaScript Design Patterns
description: Learn the importance of code organization and how to implement it with either vanilla JavaScript or an organizational library or framework.

title: Intro to Backend
description: Not Available

title: JavaScript Promises
description: Learn how to simplify asynchronous work with Native JavaScript Promises!

title: Software Debugging
description: The goal of the Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Nanodegree program is to equip software developers with the engineering and operational skills required to build automation tools and responses that ensure designed solutions respond to non-functional requirements such as availability, performance, security, and maintainability. The content will focus on both designing systems to automate response to issues with software sites as well as how to respond to common on-call situations.
skills_learnt: Toil reduction , Data recovery , Site reliability engineering business context , Deployment automation

title: HTML5 Canvas
description: Learn how you can use HTML5 Canvas to create and modify images or even interactive animations.

title: Web Accessibility
description: In this course you’ll get hands-on experience making web applications accessible. You’ll understand when and why users need accessibility. Then you’ll dive into the “how”

title: Differential Equations in Action
description: Write Python code to find numerical solutions to systems of differential equations. The models you create will fight wildfires, bring spaceships back to earth, and more!

title: Responsive Images
description: Go beyond image tags! Learn how to make images a part of your responsive design workflow.

title: Swift for Beginners
description: This course offers an entry into the world of coding and an introduction to Apple’s Swift programming language. Writing in Swift, students are introduced to basic programming concepts.

title: Intro to jQuery
description: Learn how to access and modify the DOM with ease using jQuery!

title: Networking for Web Developers
description: You've used the Internet. Now find out more about how it works.

title: Intro to AJAX
description: Learn how to perform asynchronous requests as you build a web app with data from Google Street View, the New York Times and Wikipedia!

title: Shell Workshop
description: Say hello to the Unix command-line environment! This is a quick introduction to the bash shell, the most popular Unix-style shell, available on Mac, Windows, and Linux systems.

title: Intro to Theoretical Computer Science
description: Learn the basic concepts in theoretical computer science. Discover what they imply for solving tough computational challenges.

title: Intro to Information Security
description: In this program, you will learn how to evaluate, maintain, and monitor the security of computer systems. You’ll also learn how to assess threats, respond to incidents, and implement security controls to reduce risk and meet security compliance goals.
skills_learnt: Threat intelligence , Cryptography , Cybersecurity fluency , Security auditing
prerequisites: Operating system fundamentals , Command line interface basics

reviews.content: everything is great!
So far, the program is going as planned. I am doing my part to make sure I graduate and finish within the required time.
wI am learning a lot. but I wish the videos were a little longer
The program is going great, I am learning a lot. It has matched my needs and expectations well. My professors are great at what they do and the courses are very detail.
So far the program is very informative!

The program has been good so far! I am a little behind coming from no background in networking and IT, but the pace has been manageable for me. I've also appreciated all of the extra readings to help fill in my knowledge gap. The 1st project helped tremendously get me hands on experience digging through security preferences to understand the fundamentals of securing a PC. Would recommend!
The programe is very exciting  and I see it matched my needs and expectations.
Its going very well, so far I'm learning exciting material.  Very good course

The course content is quite comprehensive and so far well meeting my expectations. Looking forward for the rest!  The project was not so difficult and not so easy, it was on a well-planned balance. It covered all aspects we went through.  Thanks for all.
I'm very much enjoying the program and what I have learned so far. This program was everything I was looking for. My needs and expectations are fully met.
great
Yes, it's been very exciting. I am learning a lot and I can get hands-on which is very great
let's see :) ...not ready to review, yet. so far so good. it's fun up to now. looking forward to continue

Overall, the program is going very well. It is slightly uneven in difficulty at times - detailed discussions of policy and standards at some point, elementary Windows configuration at other - but I didn't mind this too much. This sense may stem, in part, from the fact that I was previously in the industry and am using this to get back in practice as well as earn further credentials at my current job. And for that, the hands-on aspects are great!   Despite some minor quibbles with the details of Project 1, it was a lot of fun, and was a good excuse to dive back into the details of Windows policy, even beyond what the project required. My only real complaint here is that the document itself could use some polish and more consistent, precise language.

The program has taught me some valuable information so far on how to secure a windows 10 desktop pc. It is a good starting point for more advanced concepts in the future that I plan to pursue.  I am completely satisfied with the course and I would recommend to anyone starting in cybersecurity to take it.

The program is going very well. Learning the fundamentals first and having projects to apply them to is a great way to learn. Also the reviews are great and help out with fixing your own mistakes. The Knowledge center is great as well if you have any questions.
Program is pretty good.

The program is fine. I was surprised by the focus on Windows PCs, since I'm dealing with larger business application management which usually involves lot of linux servers, apache, databases and so on... Still, the program has provided me with very useful insights and tools and I'm looking forward to the next lessons.
Great!
yet, not as i expected but, the future content are actually exciting which im looking forwards to learn!!
Yes, It has. I gives a good primer on what cybersecurity is and how deep the subject can be. The only downside is the lab. Udacity needs to fix it asap
Simple and easy to understand
This course is really taking us from the very beginning to the security best practice.

The program is going really awesome, the concepts are clearly explained and had been a lot of reading shared so it complement really well all the things learned.  It is matching perfectly my expectations so far, and the best thing is the way to learn, that I can join after work any time I want.
I like having more practical content, theory is boring.
It's going great. Thank you.

I think this programs style of introducing information is effective. If this program had more smaller/mini projects to complete along with the quiz questions for each topic that would have been helpful. Overall I am definitely satisfied.

I enjoyed the first project very much. Capturing the screenshots did get a bit tedious after a time, especially if one is able to type the steps taken in a clear, well understood manner. As an IS professional for more than 15 years I enjoyed digging into the Windows OS and learned a few things I didn't know but also learned a bit more about the how's and why's certain actions help to secure a workstation.
Yes it's going well - I'm really enjoying it - getting the first project out of the way successfully was a big bonus.
Its nice but it feels outdated
Thank you for the rapid, clean and pertinent review !
I'm very appreciating this course because I'm learning a lot of new things that I didn't expect.
Loving the experience so far.
I am really liking this program.  I has exceeded my expectations thus far.  I was in another program and I did not feel like I was learning the material well enough to confidently explain to anyone.
Video Quality & Content: Meh. Final Project: Useful, Good Final Project review: Good

It is very difficult to figure out where everything is at first and how everything works. The video lessons are alright, they get kind of boring because it is the same guy over and over again. Also a few of the links were out of date so I would recommend updating those. But besides that the course is very good, a lot of grest information and I really liked the ability to use what I am learning. What I also thought was really awesome is that at the beginning of this week I started an IT job where I am a support specialist and the things that I learned in this program I was able to directly apply at my job. My familiarity with windows and th principles of securing a PC and understanding the professional way to do it has increased tremendously. For that I say thank you.
Excelent!
The assignments are very practical. The instructions are easy to understand. I think I made a right choice.
Going good so far!
Good so far.
Wish there could be an elective course for technical stuff so that non tech background students could be better prepared for the final project
It is great and it is well worth the money that it costs.

It is going very well, I like it , and though it is an introductory course it has many interesting subjects and a lot of practical concepts. I like the methodology, the videos are very welll explained, the exercises and the project, it is a very good educative option.

IT has been a huge learning curve and the reviewer has been very very helpful as well as the mentor who has been there guiding me through. In-fact i have gained much insight through this as opposed to, if i had submitted the project and there was no problem whatsoever. i believe i have learnt more through the repeated efforts as opposed to getting it right the first time.
Love it! I am an IT professional of 15 years and I love that this program is teaching me things i never knew.
The program is very good! I'm very excited to dive in next classes!
I had great experience and I want to learn more . after I finish my course I will be ready to work I‚Äôm so happy to learn more thank you so much Udacity
Excellent

As a student who is new to both IT and Cybersecurity, the content thus far has been far more challenging than I had thought.  However, the teaching style and projects provide a great platform for learning and this has benefitted me greatly.  I am learning so much and am thankful I have the time to dedicate to my studies.    If I had to provide some advice to students considering the Nanodegree program in Cybersecurity, it would be this:  If you are brand new to both IT and Cybersecurity, and you have a full time job, it may be best to start with some of Udacity‚Äôs individual courses to familiarize yourself with the fundamentals prior to beginning the Nanodegree program.  If you have the time to devote to the program and you enjoy a challenge, you won‚Äôt be disappointed with this program.  I‚Äôve absorbed an incredible amount of knowledge so far!
Excellent.  It s different from what i am used to ( in a good way). The learning process is efficient.

I have only completed a small portion of the ND so far but it seems good. Apart from a few instructions being a bit unclear(installing the VM, a couple of questions in the first project), the program seems good so far.

I really like it.  It's a pretty good mix of hands on and tutorial videos.  There were some questions that were a little vague and therefore confusing.  And there were a couple of things in the project that weren't covered in the material.  Some of the material is a little outdated (e.g. CIS now only has 18 controls vs 20).  But overall, I like it.  When first signing up, I didn't not know we would need to set up an account with Azure, nor did I know what to expect with the projects.  So maybe a little more transparency about what you are getting into when you sign up would be good.
The program is going great! Material is good and it helps you learn what needs to be done at a practical level.
The experience is great. The course is all what I expected for a beginner class. I am looking forward to learning new technology.

The program is going well. Udacity has matched my needs and expectations. The course content clear and the mentors/reviewers are really good in answering questions and providing great feedback for the project.
This is the first program I took from curiosity. I think the teaching is good but the  project makes it great.
Perfectly, thank you
Every thing is going on the right way. But it needs more time to acquire all the concepts.

Thank you in advance for all your efforts. until now the program extended my knowledge about the basic things in cybersecurity, also increased the awareness about how can I protect myself and my community from any harmful things that may happen online.
Enjoyed and excited to learn more
It's good, honestly above my expectations with learning material, hands on projects and project review feedbacks. Thank you so much!
It's good I have to arrange and manage my time but other than that it's good
its been really good. i learned a lot  I like the program so far
I enjoyed the project. It was fun!
This program has matched my needs and exceeded my expectations. Very practical and hands-on. The first project has been a confidence booster on my part. Keep up the good work.
Submission requirements could be more clear but having a good time learning

title: Intro to Progressive Web Apps
description: Learn how to build a progress web app, leverage Service Workers to enable your web applications to work offline, and allow users to install your app to their device's home screen.

title: Intro to Point & Click App Development
description: In this short class you'll build powerful apps without writing code. Great if you're an aspiring developer or someone who wants to learn what programmers do.

title: Browser Rendering Optimization
description: This course will demystify the browser's rendering pipeline and make it easy for you to build high performance web apps.

title: Introduction to Virtual Reality
description: If you are interested in learning more about virtual reality, this course will teach you the principles of VR technology and help you understand what you can build in VR.

title: Database Systems Concepts & Design
description: Learn how to execute core SQL commands to define, select, manipulate, control access, aggregate, and join data and data tables. Understand when and how to use subqueries, several window functions, and partitions to complete complex tasks. Clean data, optimize SQL queries and write select advanced JOINs to enhance analysis performance.

title: Advanced Operating Systems
description: Say hello to the Unix command-line environment! This is a quick introduction to the bash shell, the most popular Unix-style shell, available on Mac, Windows, and Linux systems.

title: Machine Learning: Unsupervised Learning
description: In this course, you'll learn how to apply unsupervised learning to solve real-world problems.
skills_learnt: Gaussian mixture models , Single linkage clustering , K-means clustering , Dimensionality reduction
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Basic descriptive statistics , Basic probability

title: Configuring Linux Web Servers
description: Serve a data-driven web application as you become acquainted with, configure and finally secure a Ubuntu Linux web application server.

title: Problem Solving with Advanced Analytics
description: Learn a scientific approach to solving problems with data, how to select the correct analytical methodology for an analysis, and how to use linear regression to solve business problems.

title: ES6
description: In this course, you'll explore the latest features and improvements to the JavaScript programming language including new keywords, arrow functions, the Class syntax, Promises, and so much more.

title: Kotlin for Android Developers
description: Take an Android notepad app and convert it from Java to Kotlin, learning key features of the Kotlin programming language along the way.

title: Data and Visual Analytics
description: This Data Visualization Nanodegree program covers four courses on data visualization and storytelling. Students will learn to select appropriate visualizations, design effective dashboards, and tell data stories that uncover insights and make recommendations. They will use Tableau to build interactive dashboards and create polished presentations with data visualizations. Through a series of projects, students will learn to discover user needs, identify key metrics, prototype, and design dashboards, analyze data to find insights and communicate recommendations effectively.
skills_learnt: Animated data visualizations , Flourish , Data storytelling , Data limitations and biases
prerequisites: Explanatory data analysis , Basic computer literacy , Basic descriptive statistics

Overall, program is going well. There are, however, a number of items which misaligned from other parts of the program. For instance, we are asked to include titles for our dashboard project subplots (perfectly reasonable request which I fully agree with), but every video that focused on building dashboards explicitly called out deleting those titles. Not the end of the world and to some degree this will happen because data visualization is a subjective topic. Rather, serves as an example of where things could be tightened up in order to be more user friendly.

description: Increase conversions with best practices for fast, efficient forms! Learn how to design and build web forms for users on any device.

title: CSE 8803 Special Topics: Big Data
description: There are 2 main roles in the Big Data industry: Big Data Engineer and Big Data Architect. We will focus on the Architect role. We will look at the characteristics of Big Data, its business value, and how companies are using Big Data today. We study the most popular storage and processing frameworks.....aka...Big Data ecosystem components. We will dive deep into NoSQL,  how it differs from traditional relational databases, how to model, and what the tool interface looks like. Finally, we will talk about the benefits, challenges, design patterns of Data Lake technology. Your final project is based on a real-world scenario that will require you to think like an architect and build an end-to-end data lake system proposal.
skills_learnt: Big data fluency , Distributed data processing , Data lake management , Database fundamentals
prerequisites: ETL , Relational database basics , Command line interface basics

title: Microsoft Power Platform
description: Introduction to Power Platform

title: Human-Computer Interaction
description: The UX Fundamentals & Design Research program teaches the core principles of human-centered design, including scoping a design problem, conducting in-depth interviews, creating quantitative surveys, using research data to uncover opportunities, and applying psychology to design sketches with the end user in mind. Participants will learn how to develop a discussion guide, recruit research participants, and synthesize findings in the form of a research report. They will also learn how to translate research findings into low-fidelity prototypes that can be tested with users, design high-fidelity prototypes, and conduct usability tests. Finally, the program teaches advanced user interface principles to build interactive designs that engage users and improve key performance indicators.
skills_learnt: Remote user testing , High fidelity prototypes , Design optimization , Visual style guides

title: Transformer Models and BERT Model with Google Cloud
description: This course introduces you to the Transformer architecture and the Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT) model. You learn about the main components of the Transformer architecture, such as the self-attention mechanism, and how it is used to build the BERT model. You also learn about the different tasks that BERT can be used for, such as text classification, question answering, and natural language inference.

title: iOS Interview Preparation

title: Introduction to Large Language Models with Google Cloud
description: This is an introductory level microlearning course that explores what large language models (LLM) are, the use cases where they can be utilized, and how you can use prompt tuning to enhance LLM performance. It also covers Google tools to help you develop your own Gen AI apps.

title: LLMOps: Building Real-World Applications With Large Language Models
description:
The goal of this course is to teach you everything you need to build real-world, production software with large language models. Unlike other LLM-focused courses, our emphasis will not be on theory or on building simple proof-of-concept projects in Jupyter notebooks. We will instead be exploring the operations behind production-grade LLM applications. 

This includes, but is not limited to experiment management and model versioning, fine-tuning and prompt engineering, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of LLMs, and AI safety and security (including how to protect against adversarial actors).

Along the way, we'll build several full applications, including a chatbot, an evaluation system, and a clickbait detector. Finally, we'll look at the future of LLM and LLMOps.
skills_learnt: Large Language Models , Comet ML , MLOps

title: Introduction to Image Generation with Google Cloud
description: This course introduces diffusion models, a family of machine learning models that recently showed promise in the image generation space. Diffusion models draw inspiration from physics, specifically thermodynamics. Within the last few years, diffusion models became popular in both research and industry. Diffusion models underpin many state-of-the-art image generation models and tools on Google Cloud. This course introduces you to the theory behind diffusion models and how to train and deploy them on Vertex AI.
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Basic machine learning , Convolutional neural networks

title: Attention Mechanism with Google Cloud
description: This course will introduce you to the attention mechanism, a powerful technique that allows neural networks to focus on specific parts of an input sequence. You will learn how attention works, and how it can be used to improve the performance of a variety of machine learning tasks, including machine translation, text summarization, and question answering.
prerequisites: NLP proficiency , Computer vision proficiency , Intermediate Python

title: Introduction to Digital Project Management
description: Learn the basics of digital project management that will set you up for a high-paying career.

title: Google Sheets
description:
In this course we will introduce you to Google Sheets, Google’s cloud-based spreadsheet software, included with Google Workspace.

With Google Sheets, you can create and edit spreadsheets directly in your web browser—no special software is required.

Multiple people can work simultaneously, you can see people’s changes as they make them, and every change is saved automatically.

You will learn how to open Google Sheets, create a blank spreadsheet, and create a spreadsheet from a template. You will add, import, sort, filter and format your data using Google Sheets and learn how to work across different file types.

title: VR Interview Preparation
description: Get yourself ready for the immersive realm of VR job interviews. Engage with real-world VR tasks and step into your next VR role with expertise and vision.

title: Generative AI Fundamentals with Google Cloud
description: The first lesson introduces you to microlearning aimed at explaining what Generative AI is, how it is used, and how it differs from traditional machine learning. The second lesson explores what large language models (LLM) are, the use cases, where they can be utilized, and how you can use prompt tuning to enhance LLM performance. The third lesson explains what responsible AI is, why it's important, and how Google implements responsible AI in their products. Pass the assessment in this course to demonstrate your understanding of foundational concepts in generative AI.

title: Create Image Captioning Models with Google Cloud
description: This course teaches you how to create an image captioning model by using deep learning. You learn about the different components of an image captioning model, such as the encoder and decoder, and how to train and evaluate your model. By the end of this course, you will be able to create your own image captioning models and use them to generate captions for images.
prerequisites: Intermediate Python , Basic machine learning , Computer vision proficiency

title: Encoder-Decoder Architecture with Google Cloud
description: This course gives you a synopsis of the encoder-decoder architecture, which is a powerful and prevalent machine learning architecture for sequence-to-sequence tasks such as machine translation, text summarization, and question answering. You learn about the main components of the encoder-decoder architecture and how to train and serve these models. In the corresponding lab walkthrough, you’ll code in TensorFlow a simple implementation of the encoder-decoder architecture for poetry generation from the beginning.

title: Introduction to Gen AI Studio with Google Cloud
description: This course introduces Generative AI Studio, a product on Vertex AI, that helps you prototype and customize generative AI models so you can use their capabilities in your applications. In this course, you learn what Generative AI Studio is, its features and options, and how to use it by walking through demos of the product.

title: Introduction to Responsible AI with Google Cloud
description: This is an introductory-level microlearning course aimed at explaining what responsible AI is, why it's important, and how Google implements responsible AI in their products. It also introduces Google's 7 AI principles.

title: Google Docs
description:
With Google Docs, your documents are stored in the cloud, and you can access them from any computer or device. You create and edit documents right in your web browser; no special software is required. Even better, multiple people can work at the same time, you can see people’s changes as they make them, and every change is saved automatically.

In this course, you will learn how to open Google Docs, create and format a new document, and apply a template to a new document.

You will learn how to enhance your documents using a table of contents, headers and footers, tables, drawings, images, and more.

title: AIoT Foundations
description: Immerse yourself in the full lifecycle of AIoT-enabled products and solutions by exploring AIoT use cases, designing a business model, creating a development plan, and operating the AIoT system. This free course offers a practical approach to maximizing the benefits of AIoT technologies for your current business, product, or solution—with real-life examples, best practices, and a practical toolkit.

title: Google Drive
description:
Google Drive is Google’s cloud-based file storage service. Google Drive lets you keep all your work in one place, view different file formats without the need for additional software, and access your files from any device.

In this course, you will learn how to navigate your Google Drive. You will learn how to upload files and folders and how to work across file types. You will also learn how you can easily view, arrange, organize, modify, and remove files in Google Drive.

Google Drive includes shared drives. You can use shared drives to store, search, and access files with a team. You will learn how to create a new shared drive, add and manage members, and manage the shared drive content.

title: Google Sheets - Advanced Topics
description:
This course builds on some of the concepts covered in the earlier Google Sheets course.

In this course, you will learn how to apply and customize themes in Google Sheets, and explore conditional formatting options.

You will learn about some of Google Sheets’ advanced formulas and functions. You will explore how to create formulas using functions, and you will also learn how to reference and validate your data in a Google Sheet.

Spreadsheets can hold millions of numbers, formulas, and text. Making sense of all of that data can be difficult without a summary or visualization. This course explores the data visualization options in Google Sheets, such as charts and pivot tables.

title: Gmail
description:
Gmail is Google’s cloud-based email service that allows you to access your messages from any computer or device with just a web browser.

In this course, you’ll learn how to compose, send and reply to messages. You will also explore some of the common actions that can be applied to a Gmail message, and learn how to organize your mail using Gmail labels.

You will explore some common Gmail settings and features. For example, you will learn how to manage your own personal contacts and groups, customize your Gmail Inbox to suit your way of working, and create your own email signatures and templates.

Google is famous for search. Gmail also includes powerful search and filtering. You will explore Gmail’s advanced search and learn how to filter messages automatically.

title: Google Calendar
description:
With Google Calendar, you can quickly schedule meetings and events and get reminders about upcoming activities, so you always know what’s next. Google Calendar is designed for teams, so it’s easy to share your schedule with others and create multiple calendars that you and your team can use together.

In this course, you’ll learn how to create and manage Google Calendar events. You will learn how to update an existing event, delete and restore events, and search your calendar.

You will understand when to apply different event types such as reminders, tasks, and appointment slots.

You will explore the Google Calendar settings that are available for you to customize Google Calendar to suit your way of working.

title: Strengthen Your LinkedIn Profile
description: Uncover the secrets of constructing an eye-catching Linkedin profile to expand your professional horizons, and submit your profile to be reviewed by our industry experts. You will receive personalized guidance on how to make you profile stellar and SEO-friendly - one that showcases your skills & experiences in a way that is extremely compelling and effective at making a lasting impression.

title: Google Slides
description:
With Google Slides, you can create and present professional presentations for sales, projects, training modules, and much more.

Google Slides presentations are stored safely in the cloud. You build presentations right in your web browser—no special software is required. Even better, multiple people can work on your slides at the same time, you can see people’s changes as they make them, and every change is automatically saved.

You will learn how to open Google Slides, create a blank presentation, and create a presentation from a template. You will explore themes, layout options, and how to add and format content, and speaker notes in your presentations.

title: Google Chat
description:
In this course, we introduce you to Google Chat, Google’s chat software included with Google Workspace.

You will learn about messaging individuals and groups in Google Chat. You will also discover customization options, collaboration features and how Google Chat integrates with other Google Workspace products.

We will explore the use of spaces in Google Chat, showing you how to create, manage, search, and join them. Additionally, you will understand the distinctions between using a space and a group chat.

You also explore Google Chat apps and learn how to search for and use apps within Google Chat.

title: Google Meet
description:
In this course, we introduce you to Google Meet, Google’s video conference software included with Google Workspace.

You learn how to create and manage video conference meetings using Google Meet. You explore different ways to open Google Meet and add people to a video conference. You also learn how to join meetings from different sources like calendar events or meeting links.

We discuss how Google Meet can help you better communicate, exchange ideas, and share resources with your team wherever they are. You learn how to customize the Google Meet environment to fit your needs and how to effectively use chat messages during a video conference. You also explore different ways to share resources, such as by using calendar invites or attachments.

title: Refresh Your Resume
description: Discover the art of creating a resume that stands out in the competitive job market and submit your resume to be reviewed by our industry experts. You will receive direct, constructive feedback on your resume guiding you through developing compelling narratives to showcase your skills & experiences, maximizing your chances of being noticed and shortlisted by employers.

title: Data Structures & Algorithms Interview Prep
description: Boost your confidence and excel in your next technical interview by equipping yourself with the essential problem-solving skills for data structures and algorithms interviews master key concepts, and tackle algorithmic challenges.

title: Oracle Autonomous Database Administration
description: Dive into the fundamentals of autonomous databases. Explore the process of planning, implementing, and deploying an Oracle Autonomous Database, the first and only autonomous database service in the cloud.

title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Foundations
description: This course helps you develop a strong foundation in cloud computing, core concepts and features of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).

title: Optimize Your GitHub Profile
description: Learn more about what it takes to assemble a strong Github profile and submit your profile to be reviewed by our industry professionals. You will receive personalized feedback on how to strategically curate your repositories to better enable you to establish your GitHub as a doorway to new collaborations, open-source contributions, and even job opportunities.

title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Operations Professional
description: This course is going to walk you through some of the day-to-day operational activities that you might find yourself managing in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure ecosystem.

title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Architect Associate
description: Develop key insights into key concepts and features of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). Identify how the OCI's global distribution of infrastructure components can assist your enterprise.

title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Architect Professional
description: This course will help you gain strong knowledge through hands-on experience with architecting infrastructure using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure services.

title: Zero-Shot and Few-Shot Learning
description: Optimize your generative AI prompts using zero-shot and few-shot learning techniques.

title: Self-Reflection On Your Career Pathway
description: Evolve your existing career trajectory, or find your first career by examining industry options and discovering which one works best for you. Unleash your potential to navigate the world of work with confidence, and embark on a transformative journey of self-discovery and strategic career planning.

title: Operationalizing Cloud Security with Deepfence ThreatMapper
description: This lesson focuses on operationalizing enterprise-grade cloud security programs with Deepfence Threatmapper. The demonstrations in the lesson showcase the core functionality of Threatmapper across a Kubernetes cluster in the sandbox environment. The lesson describes how a modern cloud security engineering team can use Threatmapper to run Cloud Security Engineering and Operations end-to-end. The lesson introduces concepts like Compliance Posture Scanning, Registry Scanning, Vulnerability Scanning, Secret and Local Compliance Scanning, and Secrets Scanning.

title: Craft Your Cover Letter
description: In today's job market, a well-crafted cover letter is not a mere accessory, but a powerful tool that can make a difference. Learn more about how to use your cover letter to tell a compelling story, and submit your cover letter to be reviewed by our industry experts who will give you personalized feedback on how to highlight your unique skills and make a strong case for why you're the perfect fit for a role.

title: Threads
description: In this short lesson, you will hear digital marketing experts discuss how to evaluate a new social media platform (Threads) to determine where it fits in a company's social media marketing strategy.

title: Gemini in Google Sheets
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides customers with generative AI features in Google Workspace. In this mini-course, you learn about the key features of Gemini and how they can be used to improve productivity and efficiency in Google Sheets.

title: Innovating with Google Cloud Artificial Intelligence
description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) represent an important evolution in information technologies that are quickly transforming a wide range of industries. “Innovating with Google Cloud Artificial Intelligence” explores how organizations can use AI and ML to transform their business processes.

Part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path, this course aims to help individuals grow in their role and build the future of their business.

title: Gemini in Gmail
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides customers with generative AI features in Google Workspace. In this mini-course, you learn about the key features of Gemini and how they can be used to improve productivity and efficiency in Gmail.

title: Responsible AI: Applying AI Principles with Google Cloud
description:
As the use of enterprise Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning continues to grow, so too does the importance of building it responsibly. A challenge for many is that talking about responsible AI can be easier than putting it into practice. If you’re interested in learning how to operationalize responsible AI in your organization, this course is for you.

In this course, you will learn how Google Cloud does this today, together with best practices and lessons learned, to serve as a framework for you to build your own responsible AI approach.

title: Introduction to Gemini for Google Workspace
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides customers with generative AI features in Google Workspace. In this learning path, you learn about the key features of Gemini and how they can be used to improve productivity and efficiency in Google Workspace.

title: Gemini in Google Slides
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides customers with generative AI features in Google Workspace. In this mini-course, you learn about the key features of Gemini and how they can be used to improve productivity and efficiency in Google Slides.

title: Gemini in Google Meet
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides users with access to generative AI features. This course delves into the capabilities of Gemini in Google Meet. Through video lessons, hands-on activities and practical examples, you will gain a comprehensive understanding of the Gemini features in Google Meet. You learn how to use Gemini to generate background images, improve your video quality, and translate captions. By the end of this course, you'll be equipped with the knowledge and skills to confidently utilize Gemini in Google Meet to maximize the effectiveness of your video conferences.

title: Digital Transformation with Google Cloud
description:
There's much excitement about cloud technology and digital transformation, but often many unanswered questions.

For example: What is cloud technology? What does digital transformation mean? How can cloud technology help your organization? Where do you even begin?

If you've asked yourself any of these questions, you're in the right place. This course provides an overview of the types of opportunities and challenges that companies often encounter in their digital transformation journey. If you want to learn about cloud technology so you can excel in your role and help build the future of your business, then this introductory course on digital transformation is for you. This course is part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path.

title: Exploring Data Transformation with Google Cloud
description:
Cloud technology can bring great value to an organization, and combining the power of cloud technology with data has the potential to unlock even more value and create new customer experiences.

“Exploring Data Transformation with Google Cloud” explores the value data can bring to an organization and ways Google Cloud can make data useful and accessible.

Part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path, this course aims to help individuals grow in their role and build the future of their business.

title: Trust and Security with Google Cloud
description:
As organizations move their data and applications to the cloud, they must address new security challenges. The Trust and Security with Google Cloud course explores the basics of cloud security, the value of Google Cloud's multilayered approach to infrastructure security, and how Google earns and maintains customer trust in the cloud.

Part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path, this course aims to help individuals grow in their role and build the future of their business.

title: Modernize Infrastructure and Applications with Google Cloud
description:
Many traditional enterprises use legacy systems and applications that can't stay up-to-date with modern customer expectations. Business leaders often have to choose between maintaining their aging IT systems or investing in new products and services. 'Modernize Infrastructure and Applications with Google Cloud' explores these challenges and offers solutions to overcome them by using cloud technology.

Part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path, this course aims to help individuals grow in their role and build the future of their business.

title: Scaling with Google Cloud Operations
description:
Organizations of all sizes are embracing the power and flexibility of the cloud to transform how they operate. However, managing and scaling cloud resources effectively can be a complex task.

Scaling with Google Cloud Operations explores the fundamental concepts of modern operations, reliability, and resilience in the cloud, and how Google Cloud can help support these efforts.

Part of the Cloud Digital Leader learning path, this course aims to help individuals grow in their role and build the future of their business.

title: Gemini in Google Docs
description: Gemini for Google Workspace is an add-on that provides users with access to generative AI features. This course delves into the capabilities of Gemini in Google Docs using video lessons, hands-on activities and practical examples. You learn how to use Gemini to generate written content based on prompts. You also explore using Gemini to edit text you’ve already written, helping you improve your overall productivity. By the end of this course, you'll be equipped with the knowledge and skills to confidently utilize Gemini in Google Docs to improve your writing.
